title: Granola Cups Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Chill Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cool Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'maple syrup'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'old fashioned oats'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sliced almonds'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'flaked coconut'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'flax meal'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': "nonstick baking spray with flour (such as Baker's JoyÂ®)"}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'plain whole milk Greek yogurt, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'fresh berries'}]
directions: ['Place butter and maple syrup in a large bowl and place into the microwave. Heat in 30 second intervals, stirring after every 30 seconds, until butter is melted, about 1 to 1 1/2 minutes. Remove bowl from microwave and add in vanilla, cinnamon, salt, and nutmeg. Stir until thoroughly combined. Add in oats, almonds, coconut, and flax meal. Stir until mixture is thoroughly combined.', 'Generously grease a standard muffin tin with nonstick baking spray with flour.', 'Divide oat mixture evenly between the muffin cups, about 2 heaped tablespoons per cup. With wet hands, press mixture into the bottom and up the sides of each cup. Place the pan into the fridge to chill for 15 minutes.', 'Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Bake chilled granola cups in the preheated oven until the outside edges of cups turn golden brown,\xa0 25 to 30 minutes. Remove cups from the oven; cool to room temperature in the pan, about 30 minutes.', 'Use an offset spatula or butter knife to pop them out of the pan. To serve, fill each granola cup with yogurt and top with berries. Serve immediately.']

title: Lemon Cheesecake Creme Brulee Croissants Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cool Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'croissants'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cheesecake filling, such as PhiladelphiaÂ® Cheesecake No-Bak'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'lemon curd'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'lemon zest'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}]
directions: ['Combine cheesecake filling, lemon curd and lemon zest in a bowl; stir well. Add mixture to a piping bag or large zip-top bag. Make a small cut in the corner of the bag.', 'Use a paring knife to make a small cut into the side of each croissant. Create an opening large enough to pipe the filling into. Fill each roll with about 3 tablespoons of\xa0 filling. Place filled croissants on a wire rack set inside a lined baking sheet to catch excess drippings.', 'Add sugar and water to a small saucepan and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Reduce to medium low and cook, without stirring, until lightly golden brown, about 10 minutes.\xa0Remove mixture from the heat. Working very carefully, pour sugar syrup evenly over prepared croissants to lightly coat rolls; let stand until completely cooled and lightly hardened on top, 10 to 15 minutes.']

title: Flat Croissant with Nutella and Berries Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cool Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '1'}]

directions: ['Use a rolling pin or hands to flatten the croissant to 1/4-inch thick.', 'Heat butter a medium skillet over medium heat until melted. Place croissant in skillet, bottom side down, and press firmly with bottom of a smaller skillet or saucepan until lightly browned, about 3 minutes.\xa0 Drizzle honey evenly over croissant and add remaining butter to skillet. Flip croissant over and press again, cooking until the top side is lightly browned and toasted, about 2 minutes. Remove to a plate to cool.', 'Spread Nutella over the croissant and top with berries as desired.']

title: Carrot Cake Pancakes Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 carrot pancakes'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 Â¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'pumpkin pie spice'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking soda'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'table salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'whole buttermilk'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'packed light brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely grated carrot'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'unsalted butter, melted, plus more for griddle'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'To make the pancake batter: Whisk flour, baking powder, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl.', 'Add buttermilk, brown sugar, egg, and vanilla; stir until just combined. Stir in carrots and melted butter until just combined. Set batter aside while you prepare the frosting and topping.', 'To make the frosting: Whisk cream cheese, milk, powdered sugar, and vanilla together in a medium bowl until smooth. Set aside.', 'To prepare the topping: Stir raisins, pecans, coconut, and ginger together in a small bowl. title: Chorizo Breakfast Casserole Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'lb', 'Name': 'chorizo, casings removed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'orange bell pepper, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'poblano chile'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'half and half'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'garlic salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'onion powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon freshly ground', 'Name': 'freshly ground'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'shredded mild Cheddar cheese'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'shredded pepper Jack cheese'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'refrigerated shredded hash browns'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'avocados, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'scallions'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly coat a 13- x 9-inch baking dish with cooking spray.', 'Heat a large skillet over medium-high. Remove skillet from heat.', 'Whisk together eggs, half-and-half, garlic salt, onion powder, black pepper, and chili powder in a large bowl until fully combined. Stir in sausage, bell pepper and poblano, and cheeses until well combined.', 'Spread hashbrowns in an even layer in prepared baking dish. title: CrÃªpes Suzette Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'whole milk'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'unsalted butter, melted, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'freshly grated orange zest'}]
directions: ['To make the crÃªpes: Combine milk, water, eggs, sugar, and salt in a blender; blend on medium speed until smooth, about 10 seconds. Add flour and blend until smooth, about 5 more seconds. Add 2 tablespoons of the melted butter and orange zest; pulse until incorporated, about 3 (1-second) pulses. Cover blender and place in refrigerator; let rest for 15 minutes.', 'Remove crÃªpe batter from fridge. Heat a 6-inch nonstick skillet or crÃªpe pan over medium heat. Add 1/2 teaspoon of the melted butter and swirl to coat skillet. Add 2 tablespoons batter and swirl to coat bottom of skillet. Cook, undisturbed, until the bottom is lightly golden, and the top is still a little moist, about 1 minute. Swirl skillet to loosen crÃªpe and gently flip with a spatula and your fingers. Cook until golden, about 30 seconds. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining butter and batter.', 'To make the orange sauce: Combine orange juice, white sugar, and orange zest in a small skillet over medium heat. Cook, stirring often, until sugar is dissolved and the liquid starts to bubble, 3 to 4 minutes. Gradually add butter, piece by piece, stirring constantly, until it is melted and fully incorporated. Let sauce come back up to a simmer and let simmer until slightly syrupy, stirring occasionally, about 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in orange liqueur and salt. Remove from the heat.', 'Fold each crÃªpe in half, then half again to make a triangle. Dip the folded crÃªpes into the hot orange sauce. Place on a serving platter. Repeat with remaining crÃªpes, overlapping each crÃªpe so they are facing the same direction.', 'To serve, pour orange liqueur into the skillet with the remaining orange sauce and place over medium-high. If it does not ignite automatically, use a long-stemmed lighter and carefully set the liqueur on fire. Let it burn for about 30 seconds. Pour the flaming liqueur over the crÃªpes on the platter and serve immediately with ice cream.']

title: Chocolate Chip Pancakes Recipe

title: Orange Cinnamon Rolls Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 cinnamon rolls'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'warm whole milk (110 degrees F (43 degrees C))'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(.25 ounce) package', 'Name': 'active dry yeast'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg, room temperature'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg yolk, room temperature'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'unsalted butter, softened'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'honey'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'freshly grated orange zest'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'freshly squeezed orange juice'}, {'Quantity': '3 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour, divided, or more as needed'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}]
directions: ['Pour warmed milk into the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment for the dough. Sprinkle yeast evenly over the surface of the milk. Let stand until foamy, 5 to 10 minutes.', 'Add egg and egg yolk, butter, honey, orange zest, and orange juice to the yeast mixture. Beat on low until combined, about 45 seconds. Add 2 cups flour; beat on low until a wet dough forms, about 1 minute. Turn off mixer; switch to the dough hook attachment. Add 1 Â½ cups flour and salt, beat on medium until dough is soft and elastic, 7 to 10 minutes. If necessary, add an additional Â½ cup flour, tablespoon by tablespoon, using as little as possible to achieve a soft dough. The dough should be quite sticky.', 'Gather dough into a ball and transfer to a large greased bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and set aside to rise at room temperature until doubled in size, about 1 hour.', 'To make the filling: Combine butter, brown sugar, cinnamon, and orange zest in a bowl. Mix with a spatula until smooth and creamy, about 1 minute. Set aside.', 'Grease a 13x9-inch baking dish; set aside. Punch down the dough and transfer to a well-floured surface. Roll dough into a large 10x18-inch rectangle. Spread the filling over the surface of the dough, leaving a Â½ inch border along the top long edge.', 'Roll the dough away from you to create a log, and pinch seam to seal.', 'Cut dough log into 12 equal rolls (about 1 Â½ inches wide). Transfer rolls to prepared baking dish. Loosely cover with plastic wrap, and set aside to rise at room temperature until puffy and almost doubled in size, 30 to 45 minutes.', 'Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).', 'Bake rolls in the preheated oven until golden brown, 22 to 25 minutes.', 'While rolls are baking, prepare the frosting. Combine cream cheese, powdered sugar, orange zest, orange zest, and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment. Beat at medium-high speed until very smooth and creamy, 2 to 3 minutes.', 'Remove rolls from oven and transfer to a wire rack. Let cool 2 minutes, then spread frosting evenly over the rolls. Serve warm.']

title: Chef Johnâ€™s Tortilla de Patatas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Stand Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'Yukon gold potatoes or russet potatoes, peeled'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'yellow onion'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'olive oil'}]
directions: ['Slice potatoes and onions with a very sharp knife or mandoline into 1/8-inch thick slices.', 'Combine eggs, 1/2 teaspoon salt, black pepper, and cayenne in a large bowl and whisk very thoroughly; set aside.', 'Add 1/3 cup olive oil to a large nonstick pan and set heat to medium-high. Add potatoes, onions, and remaining salt. Cook, tossing and stirring occasionally, until potatoes are tender, and some onions and potatoes are lightly browned, about 20 minutes. Between stirrings, cover potatoes to reduce cooking time and keep in moisture. For less browning, reduce heat to medium.', 'Stir potato mixture into egg mixture with a spatula. Cover and let stand for 5 to 10 minutes.', 'Add remaining olive oil to an 8- or 9-inch nonstick pan, and set the pan over medium-high heat. Pour in egg and potato mixture, and smooth the top. Cook, covered, for about 4 minutes or until the bottom is browned and the edges of tortilla begin to firm up.', 'Slide tortilla out onto a plate, cover with another plate, and flip the plates over to invert. Slide tortilla back into the pan, and place back over medium-high heat.', 'Cook, uncovered, until the tortilla is fully set, about 2 minutes more. Tortilla will spring back lightly when pressed in the middle with a finger if eggs are fully cooked. If it feels soft or mushy when pressed, cook for a few minutes more, unless you prefer the tortilla less than fully set.', 'Slip tortilla onto a serving plate, and serve hot, warm, or room temperature.']

title: Asparagus and Eggs Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '1'}]

directions: ['Heat a small skillet over medium-high heat. Add olive oil and garlic; cook and stir until garlic is fragrant, about 30 seconds.', 'Add asparagus and cook until fork-tender, turning asparagus often to ensure even cooking, about 4 minutes.', 'Spread asparagus out and crack 2 eggs over the asparagus. Cover with lid and cook until egg whites are firm and yolk is done to desired consistency, about 4 minutes.', 'Season with salt and pepper; sprinkle with red pepper flakes and serve immediately.']

title: Sausage and Cheese Egg Boats Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Stand Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'breakfast sausage'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'loaf', 'Name': 'Cuban bread, French loaf'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'shredded Cheddar'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'heavy cream'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red bell pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'green onion'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment.', 'Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir sausage in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain any excess grease; set aside to cool slightly.', 'Using a serrated knife, trim off the top layer of bread to expose the inside. Create a well for the fillings by removing most of the bread on the inside.\xa0Place 3/4 cup cheese along the bottom of the bread; place bread on the prepared baking sheet.', 'Whisk eggs, cream, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl until well blended. Stir in cooked sausage, bell pepper, green onions, and remaining cheese; pour mixture into prepared bread loaf.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until eggs are set, 35 to 40 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes before slicing and serving.']

title: Mexican Oatmeal Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '1'}]

title: The Ultimate Brunch Casserole
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'hashbrowns'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'chorizo'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'yellow onion'}, {'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'grated cheddar cheese'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'sour cream'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'whole milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'green onions'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'avocado'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'pickled jalapeÃ±os'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Spread hash browns over the bottom of the baking dish.', 'Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add chorizo and onion, using a flat wooden spoon to break up the meat into smaller pieces. Cook until browned, about 8 to 10 minutes. Set aside.', 'Whisk eggs, 2 cups Cheddar cheese, 1 cup sour cream, milk, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Stir in chorizo mixture.', 'Pour egg mixture over hash browns in baking dish. Dollop remaining 1/2 cup sour cream over eggs, and sprinkle with remaining 1 cup cheese.', 'Bake for 35 to 45 minutes, until just set in the center. Sprinkle with green onions, avocado, and pickled jalapeÃ±os, if using. Cut into squares and serve immediately.']

title: Easy McGriddle Casserole Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'breakfast sausage'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'bacon'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'complete (â€œjust add waterâ€) pancake mix'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'maple syrup'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.', 'Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir sausage in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease. Set aside to cool slightly.', 'Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned and crisp, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Crumble when cool enough to handle.', 'Whisk together pancake mix and water until well combined. Stir in maple syrup. Add sausage, bacon, and cheese and fold the mixture together until well incorporated. Pour mixture into prepared baking dish.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until casserole is lightly browned, and a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes.', 'Spread butter over hot casserole and serve with extra syrup as desired.']

title: Cinnamon Roll Focaccia Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Rise Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs 35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12 (serving size: 1 [3- x 3-inch] piece)'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'canola oil,'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(1-pound)', 'Name': 'pizza dough'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'light brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'cream cheese'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'powdered sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'whole milk'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients. Evenly coat a 13- x 9-inch baking pan with 1/4 cup of the oil.', 'On a lightly floured work surface, using your hands or a rolling pin, press dough balls into about 1-inch thickness. Stir together 2 tablespoons light brown sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon in a small bowl. Sprinkle the top of one dough round evenly with sugar mixture, place second dough round on top, and knead together until combined and one ball of dough is formed.', 'Place dough in the prepared pan, cover with plastic wrap, and let rest in a warm place for 3 hours, removing plastic every hour and gently pressing out dough as thin as possible.', 'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).', 'Uncover dough, and spread into an even layer pressing into the edges of the pan. Grease your hands and make deep dimples all over the top of the dough with your fingertips. Drizzle evenly with remaining 1 tablespoon oil, and make dimples all over top of the dough with your fingertips again.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until slightly risen and starting to brown, 8 to 10 minutes. Meanwhile, melt 6 tablespoons of the butter in a small saucepan over medium. Remove from heat, add remaining 1/4 cup light brown sugar and remaining 1 teaspoon cinnamon, and stir until combined; drizzle evenly over dough. Return to oven and bake at 450 degrees F (230 degrees C) until well browned and puffed, 8 to 10 more minutes.', 'Meanwhile, combine cream cheese and remaining 1 tablespoon butter in a bowl and beat on medium speed with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy, about 30 seconds. Gradually add powdered sugar, beating at low speed until blended, about 30 seconds. Stir in milk and vanilla until icing is smooth and creamy.', 'Drizzle icing over hot bread; serve warm.']

title: Breakfast Burrito with Potatoes and Chorizo Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'chorizo'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'poblano pepper, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'yellow onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red bell pepper, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'Yukon gold potatoes,'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'half-and-half'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'shredded cheese, any kind'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'burrito-sized', 'Name': 'flour tortilla'}]
directions: ['Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add chorizo, poblano pepper, onions, and red bell pepper. Cook until vegetables are tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove skillet from heat.', 'In a microwave-safe bowl, cook potatoes with a small amount of water until fork tender, 7 to 10 minutes, stirring halfway through; drain. Stir potatoes into chorizo mixture.', 'Meanwhile, whisk eggs, half-and-half, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl.', 'Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add egg mixture and scramble until eggs are cooked, about 3 minutes. Remove eggs from heat. Fold in cheese.', 'Spoon chorizo mixture in a line across the middle of a tortilla, then add a layer of scrambled eggs. Fold opposing edges of the tortilla to overlap the filling. Roll 1 of the opposing edges around the filling creating a burrito.']

title: Naked Eggs Benedict Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'deli ham'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 2 (5 ounce) ramekins (or 2 wells of a standard muffin tin) with melted butter.', 'Line each ramekin with two slices of ham, being sure to get the edges even around the top.', 'Crack 1 egg into a small bowl; gently transfer to a ham-lined ramekin; repeat with the second egg. Season each egg with salt and cayenne, to taste.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until the whites are just barely set, and the yolks are still soft and a little runny, 20 to 25 minutes. The eggs will continue to cook and set more firmly once removed from the oven if left in the hot ramekins.', 'When eggs have 10 minutes cook time remaining, make lemon butter sauce. Add lemon juice, water, and salt to a small pan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, and simmer until liquid has reduced by about half, 1 to 2 minutes.', 'Reduce heat to lowest setting and add butter slices. Start swirling and shaking the pan until butter is almost fully emulsified, then turn off the heat. Continue swirling pan until butter is entirely melted. Taste; add cayenne or hot sauce if using. Keep pan in a warm spot until needed. Sauce will thicken slightly as it cools', 'Toast and butter English muffins, transfer baked ham and eggs onto muffin halves, and spoon warm sauce over. Sprinkle with chives and serve immediately.']

title: Baked Yogurt Custard Toast Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 custard toasts'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'French bread'}, {'Quantity': '1/2 cup plus 2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'Greek yogurt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'honey'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'lemon zest'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with a silicone mat or parchment.', 'Butter one side of bread, and place butter-side-down on the prepared baking sheet.', 'Whisk together yogurt, honey, vanilla extract, lemon zest, egg, and salt in a mixing bowl. Spoon custard mixture over bread, all the way to the edges, and pressing down lightly as you apply, to help the bread absorb as much as possible. Try to use all the custard.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 20 to 25 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, stir blueberries, strawberries, maple syrup, and lemon juice together in a bowl; set aside until needed.', 'Serve custard toast immediately topped with fresh fruit.']

title: Uova in Purgatorio (Eggs in Purgatory) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'black Italian olives, pitted and chopped, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'capers'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'anchovy fillet in oil, drained'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'Italian tomato sauce (crushed tomatoes)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'sprig', 'Name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}]
directions: ['Heat oil in a skillet over low heat. Add garlic, olives, capers, and anchovy; cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add tomato sauce and water, bring to a boil, and simmer until flavors combine, about 10 minutes. Add parsley and season with salt.', 'Gently add eggs directly into tomato sauce without breaking the yolks. Cook until eggs are just cooked, 3 to 5 minutes.']

title: Shakshuka for One Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '1'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'button mushrooms, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red onion'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'peppers and/or sweet peppers'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cumin'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'smoked paprika'}, {'Quantity': '1/8', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '1/8', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'dried oregano'}, {'Quantity': '1/8', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper, plus more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water, or more as needed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'fresh cilantro, divided'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'feta cheese, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'Aleppo chili flakes'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sliced bread to serve alongside'}]
directions: ['Add 1 tablespoon olive oil to a small pan or skillet.', 'Place mushrooms in a single layer in the skillet, and sprinkle with a pinch of salt. Top with onions, then peppers, and another pinch of salt.', 'Place on medium high heat, and wait for mushrooms to start sizzling. Cook until bottoms of mushrooms are nicely browned, about 3 minutes, and then stir everything together and cook for 1 minute more.', 'Add cumin, paprika, turmeric, oregano, black pepper, and cayenne and cook, stirring, for another 30 to 60 seconds. Stir in tomato puree and water, and wait for mixture to simmer. Stir in cilantro, and scatter over half the feta.', 'Use a spoon to make a well in the center, and transfer in the egg. Reduce heat to medium low, cover, and cook until the egg is done to your liking, 3 to 5 minutes.', 'Serve immediately topped with Aleppo chili flakes, and the remaining olive oil, feta, and cilantro, with bread on the side.']

title: Orange French Toast Bake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'riple Sec'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'orange, zested and juiced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'orange extract'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/8', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'nutmeg'}, {'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'cinnamon raisin bread'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'confectioners sugar, or as needed (optional)'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'maple syrup, or as needed'}]

title: Croissant French Toast Bake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Stand Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 9x13-inch baking dish'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'heavy cream'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'croissants (about 1 1/4 pounds), halved horizontally'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': "confectioner's sugar"}]

Serve with desired toppings.']

title: Chef John's Chinese Scallion Pancakes
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '2 pancakes'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'bread flour'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'very hot water'}]
directions: ['Combine bread flour and salt in a large bowl. Make a well in the middle and pour in hot water. Mix together with a wooden spoon to form a shaggy dough.', 'Transfer dough onto a lightly floured work surface. Knead dough until sticky but relatively smooth and elastic, dusting with a minimal amount of flour if needed. Wrap in plastic wrap and let dough rest for 2 hours.', 'Mix vegetable oil, sesame oil, and flour together in a skillet over medium heat until starting to bubble, about 3 minutes. Cook for 1 minute more. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature.', 'Unwrap dough and cut in half. Roll out into a tube and press down with your fingers. Use a rolling pin to flatten dough into a rectangular shape about 1/8-inch thick, flipping over and dusting lightly with flour halfway through.', 'Paint surface of the dough with the oil mixture until just covered, leaving 1 inch of space on the edges. Sprinkle scallions on top. Roll dough up tightly to seal in the scallions, starting with the long side. Pull the opposite edge over the top once you have reached it.', 'Coil 1 end of the dough inward toward the middle; wrap the opposite end around the coil to finish, tucking the tip under the bottom. Dust the coil with flour and roll dough out into a pancake about 1/4-inch thick. Repeat with remaining dough, oil, and green onions to make the second pancake.', 'Heat vegetable oil in a cast iron skillet over high heat. Add 1 pancake; lower heat to medium. Cook until crispy and browned, about 4 minutes per side. Repeat with the other pancake. Cut into wedges.']

title: Chinese Braised Pork Belly
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '24 pieces'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'skinless pork belly'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'canola oil'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water, or more if needed'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'green onions, diagonally cut into 2-inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, smashed'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'fino dry sherry'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'reduced-sodium soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'dark molasses'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'whole star anise'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cucumber, thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onion, thinly sliced'}]
directions: ['Cut pork into eight 2x3-inch pieces.', 'Heat oil in a 6-quart Dutch oven over high heat. In 2 batches, sear pork, fat sides first, until light golden, 30 to 60 seconds per side. Transfer to a plate. Pour out all but 1 to 2 tablespoons of the drippings.', 'Add 1/3 cup sugar to pot; melt, stirring if needed, over medium-high heat. Cook until a light caramel color, about 1 minute. Reduce heat to medium, then return pork to pot, turning pieces to coat. When sugar darkens to an orange color, after about 1 minute, add water; stir to loosen any sugar stuck to the bottom.', 'Add green onions, garlic, sherry, soy sauce, molasses, star anise, and remaining 2 tablespoons sugar. If needed, add up to 1/2 cup additional water to nearly cover pork. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer, covered, turning occasionally, until a knife inserted 1/4 inch into the fat layer meets little resistance, about 1 hour and 45 minutes.', 'Transfer pork to a plate with a slotted spoon; loosely cover. Skim fat and drain solids from cooking liquid. Return 4 cups liquid to pot and bring to a boil; simmer over medium-high heat until reduced to about 1 cup, about 30 minutes. Sauce will thicken more as it cools.', 'Slice pork into twenty-four 1/2-inch-thick pieces. Working in batches, warm pork with half the sauce in a large nonstick skillet over medium to medium-high heat. Turn pork frequently to coat and, if desired, let sear slightly. Garnish with cucumber slices and sliced green onion.']

title: Baked Sweet and Sour Chicken Thighs with Pineapple Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '2'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken thighs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'onion chunks'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green bell pepper,'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red bell pepper,'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'pineapple chunks'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'ketchup'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'brown sugar, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'low-sodium soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'clove garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ginger paste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onion, sliced, or as needed (optional)'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking dish or spray with cooking spray.', 'Pat chicken thighs dry with a paper towel, cut into 1-inch chunks, and add to the dish. Sprinkle with cornstarch, and toss until chicken is coated. Stir in onions, green and red bell peppers, and pineapple.', 'Add ketchup, rice vinegar, brown sugar, soy sauce, garlic, and ginger paste to a small bowl, whisk until well combined, and stir into the chicken mixture.', 'Bake until chicken is no longer pink at the center and juices run clear, 14 to 17 minutes, stirring halfway through. An instant-read thermometer inserted near the center should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). If sauce is a bit thick, stir in a splash of water to thin out until you reach your desired consistency.', 'Garnish with green onion slices and serve.']

title: Thanksgiving Turkey Congee Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dried scallops'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'dried black mushrooms'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'uncooked short-grain white rice'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'leftover turkey carcass, broken into pieces'}, {'Quantity': '9', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}]
directions: ['Place dried scallops and dried mushrooms in a bowl; pour in hot water to cover and let stand to rehydrate, about 10 minutes. Rinse and drain rice; set aside.', 'Separate any meat from bones of turkey carcass; set aside. Place bones and 9 cups hot water in a large stockpot and bring to a boil. Drain mushrooms and scallops; squeeze out any excess water. Break scallops into smaller pieces; slice mushrooms thinly.', 'Stir scallops, mushrooms, rice, and turkey meat into the stockpot; reduce heat to allow congee to simmer, partially covered, stirring occasionally for a smooth congee, until rice is tender and congee is thick, about 2 hours. If you like a thinner congee, stir in hot water a few tablespoons at a time.', 'Ladle congee into individual bowls; top each bowl with cilantro, green onions, ginger, peanuts, red onion, sesame oil, and white pepper as desired.']

title: Chilled Lo Mein Noodles with Szechuan Peppercorns Recipe

Use kitchen shears to cut noodles into smaller pieces.', 'For vinaigrette, whisk together oil, vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, jalapeÃ±o, garlic, and peppercorns in a small bowl until sugar dissolves.', 'In a serving bowl, toss noodles with vinaigrette until well coated. Top with peanuts, green onions, and cilantro.']

title: Sheet Pan General Tso's Chicken and Broccoli Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'sambal oelek'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'hoisin sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'toasted sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'light brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'minced garlic'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'broccoli florets'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'frozen fully-cooked chicken nuggets'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'cooked white rice, or as needed, for serving'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onions (optional)'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sesame seeds (optional)'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).', 'Whisk sambal oelek, rice vinegar, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, sesame oil, brown sugar, and garlic together in a small saucepan. Heat over low heat until warm, about 5 minutes; set aside.', 'Place broccoli florets in a microwave safe bowl. Microwave on High for 2 minutes. Add olive oil, salt, and pepper; toss to coat.', 'Place nuggets on one half of a large baking sheet. Spread broccoli on the other half of the baking sheet.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.', 'Place nuggets in a large bowl. Drizzle sauce over the top, and toss until evenly coated. Serve chicken over rice with roasted broccoli. Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds.']

title: 4-Ingredient Orange Chicken Recipe

directions: ['Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place frozen nuggets in a single layer on a baking sheet.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until hot and crispy, 11 to 13 minutes, or according to package directions.', 'Meanwhile, whisk marmalade, BBQ sauce, and soy sauce together in a small saucepan and heat over low heat until hot, about 5 minutes.', 'Place nuggets in a large bowl. Drizzle sauce over the top. Toss to coat.']

title: Copycat Din Tai Fung Cucumber Salad Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Stand Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(1 1/4 pound)', 'Name': 'English cucumber'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'toasted sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'chili oil'}]
directions: ['Place cucumbers in a large bowl. Sprinkle with salt and let stand for 30 minutes.', 'Rinse cucumbers with water to remove salt, and pat dry with paper towels.', 'In a separate bowl whisk soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, sugar, sesame oil, and chili oil until smooth.', 'Add cucumber slices to the oil mixture; stir to combine. Let stand for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.']

title: Baked Sweet And Sour Chicken Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '4 (6-ounce)', 'Name': 'boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1 inch cubes'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1 3/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'multicolored bell peppers'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'ketchup'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'pineapple juice'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'honey'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'cooked white rice'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients. Preheat oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C) with racks in upper and lower third positions. Grease each of 2 baking sheets with 1 tablespoon of the oil along 1 of the short sides; set aside.', 'Sprinkle chicken evenly with pepper and 1 1/2 teaspoons of the salt, and place in a bowl. Add eggs, and stir to coat. Place flour in a shallow bowl or baking dish. Working in batches, dredge chicken in flour, and shake off excess. Divide chicken between the prepared baking sheets, spreading in an even layer along short edges.', 'Divide bell peppers among baking sheets, spreading evenly along other short edges. Drizzle bell peppers evenly with remaining 2 tablespoons oil, and toss gently to coat.', 'Bake in the preheated oven, rotating baking sheets halfway through, until chicken is browned in spots, about 15 minutes. Remove chicken and bell peppers from the oven; use a spatula to carefully flip chicken only . Return to the oven, and continue baking at 475 degrees F (245 degrees C) until chicken is crispy and a thermometer inserted into thickest portion of chicken registers 165 degrees F (73 degrees C), about 5 minutes.', 'While chicken is baking, whisk together ketchup, pineapple juice, honey, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium, whisking occasionally. Reduce to a simmer over medium-low, and cook, stirring often, until mixture is reduced to 3/4 cup and coats back of spoon, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat.', 'Pour 1/4 cup of the prepared sauce over chicken on the baking sheets; toss to coat evenly. Divide rice, chicken, and bell peppers evenly among bowls. Drizzle evenly with remaining 1/2 cup sauce. Serve immediately.']

title: Copycat Panda Express Orange Chicken Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6 to 8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'flour'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'white pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'peanut or canola oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1-inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'peanut oil, or as needed, for frying'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'sesame oil, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'crushed red pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ginger'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'minced garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'orange juice'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'cooked rice, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onions for garnish'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sesame seeds for garnish (optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'orange zest'}]
directions: ['Whisk together flour, cornstarch, salt, and white pepper in a large bowl.\xa0 Add egg, water, and 1 1/2 tablespoons oil and stir to combine (mixture will be like a sticky batter).\xa0Add chicken pieces to batter and toss well to coat.\xa0Let chicken stand in refrigerator while oil heats.', 'Pour oil into a deep saucepan filled about 2 inches deep.\xa0Heat oil to 375 degrees C (190 degrees F).', 'Combine 3 tablespoons cold water with cornstarch in a small bowl and stir until cornstarch is dissolved.\xa0Pour mixture into saucepan and stir to combine.\xa0Bring mixture to a boil and reduce to simmer, stirring constantly until sauce thickens.\xa0Turn heat off and keep warm while chicken is cooking.', 'Working in batches, add coated chicken pieces carefully to the hot oil.\xa0Oil temperature will reduce when food is added. Cook chicken at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), stirring occasionally, until golden brown and crispy, 5 to 6 minutes. Remove chicken with a slotted spoon and drain on a wire rack set over paper towels.\xa0Bring oil temperature back up to 365 to 375 degrees F (185 to 190 degrees C) and repeat process with remaining chicken.', 'Return sauce mixture to medium heat, add more water if necessary if sauce thickens too much.\xa0Once hot, add in cooked chicken pieces and toss well to coat.\xa0Stir in remaining sesame oil and orange zest and serve over hot cooked rice.\xa0Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds if desired.']

title: Ginger Chicken Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup packed', 'Name': 'light brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'wine or rice vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '1/8', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'white pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'tap water, divided'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '4', 'Name': 'scallions, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'boneless, skinless chicken thighs'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'fresh ginger'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sesame seeds for garnish'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white rice, for serving'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Whisk together brown sugar, soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, white pepper, and 1/2 cup of the water until combined; set aside. Thinly slice scallions, and separate white and light green parts from dark green parts; set aside.', 'Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high until shimmering. Sprinkle both sides of chicken evenly with salt and black pepper. Add chicken to skillet, rounded sides down, and cook until golden brown, about 10 minutes. Flip chicken, and continue to cook until a thermometer inserted into thickest portion registers 165 degrees F (73 degrees C), about 5 minutes. Transfer to a large plate, and cover loosely with aluminum foil to keep warm.', 'Add ginger, garlic, and reserved white and light green scallion parts to drippings in skillet, and cook over medium-high, stirring often, until garlic and ginger are fragrant and lightly toasted, and scallions are starting to fall apart, 3 to 4 minutes.', 'Whisk together cornstarch and remaining 1 tablespoon water until smooth. Add cornstarch mixture and soy sauce mixture to skillet. Bring to a boil over medium-high. Reduce heat to low to maintain a simmer, and cook, stirring constantly, until sauce thickens and coats the back of a spoon, about 1 minute. Remove from heat.', 'Return chicken and any residual juices to skillet, tossing to coat evenly in soy sauce mixture. Garnish with sesame seeds and dark green scallion parts. Serve over rice.']

title: Veggie Lo Mein Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'low-sodium soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'hoisin sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'toasted sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'riracha, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'whole-grain spaghetti'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'aby Bella mushrooms, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'snow peas, halved'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'red bell pepper, cored and sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrot, peeled and cut into matchsticks'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'onion, peeled and sliced vertically'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}]
directions: ['Whisk soy sauce, hoisin sauce, sesame oil, brown sugar, and Sriracha together in a small bowl until well blended; set aside.', 'Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta, stirring occasionally; cook until nearly tender with a bite, 7 to 8 minutes, and drain well.', 'Meanwhile, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet or wok. Add mushrooms, snow peas, red bell pepper, carrot, onion, and garlic. title: Lazy Wonton Soup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'quarts', 'Name': 'chicken stock or broth'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'bunch', 'Name': 'green onions, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'garlic clove, thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '3-inch', 'Name': 'fresh ginger,'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce, plus more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground pork'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'toasted sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'heads', 'Name': 'baby bok choy'}, {'Quantity': '20', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'wonton wrappers'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'Sriracha hot sauce'}]
directions: ['Place chicken stock in a large saucepan or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Cut white parts of green onions into 1-inch pieces and add to broth. Add garlic clove. Thinly slice 1 inch ginger (or 1 teaspoon ground)\xa0 and add to stock. Add 1 tablespoon soy sauce, vinegar, brown sugar and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Bring mixture to a boil, stirring occasionally.', 'Place pork in a bowl. Finely slice remaining green parts of green onions. Set aside 3 tablespoons for garnish. Add remaining onions to the bowl; grate in remaining 2-inch piece of ginger. Add remaining soy sauce, remaining salt, sesame oil, and cornstarch to the bowl; mix until well combined.', 'Form mixture into 1-inch balls and add to broth. Alternatively, use a small spoon to drop heaping teaspoons full of meat into broth. Reduce heat to a simmer; cook 5 minutes. Add wonton wrappers, bok choy, and additional soy sauce to taste. Cook 8 minutes, stirring occasionally.', 'Serve with reserved green onions and hot sauce or chili crisp if desired.']

title: Sesame Chicken with Broccoli Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'boneless skinless chicken breast, cut into 1-inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'white pepper, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'garlic'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'fresh ginger'}, {'Quantity': '1/4 cup plus 1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'oil of choice, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'hoisin sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'sambal oelek, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'carrots, cut into matchsticks'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'shallots'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'broccoli florets'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'sesame seeds, or to taste'}]
directions: ['Place chicken pieces in a bowl. Sprinkle with cornstarch, salt, and white pepper. Toss chicken to coat evenly and set aside.', 'Heat 1 teaspoon cooking oil in a small nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and ginger and cook, stirring, until fragrant, about 1 minute.', 'Stir in soy sauce, hoisin sauce, rice vinegar, sambal oelek, and sesame oil. Bring to a boil and cook, stirring, about 1 minute. Remove from heat and set aside.', 'Heat 2 tablespoons oil over medium-high heat in a large nonstick skillet or wok until very hot. Add chicken pieces carefully to the hot oil. Cook, stirring, until chicken pieces are lightly browned on all sides, 8 to 10 minutes total. The chicken pieces will cause spattering, so be sure to use a long-handled spoon or other utensil to move the chicken around.', 'Using a slotted spoon, remove chicken from the skillet and add the remaining 2 tablespoons cooking oil. Add carrots, shallots, and broccoli, and stir quickly and continually, 3 to 4 minutes.', 'Stir in prepared sauce, and cook until the vegetables are as tender as you like, 2 to 3 minutes.', 'Place cornstarch in a small bowl and stir in 1 tablespoon soy sauce. Keep stirring until there are no lumps. Add cornstarch slurry to the skillet and rapidly stir until well combined. Return chicken pieces and cook, stirring often, until heated through, 2 to 3 minutes.', 'Remove from heat, sprinkle with sesame seeds, and serve hot.']

title: Crispy Chinese Noodles Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(10 ounce) package', 'Name': 'egg roll wrappers'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'vegetable oil, or as needed'}]
directions: ['Gather the ingredients.', 'Cut egg roll wrappers into 1-inch strips.', 'Heat a wok over medium heat until very hot. Pour oil into the hot wok and heat until shimmering. To test the heat, lower the tip of a wooden chopstick into the oil; if it bubbles vigorously, the oil is ready.', 'Gently place 2 to 3 strips into hot oil; cook until beginning to brown on one side, 30 seconds to 1 minute. Gently flip and cook until crisp and golden brown all over, 30 seconds to 1 minute more.', 'Use a slotted spoon to transfer fried strips to a paper towel-lined plate. Repeat to fry remaining strips.']

title: Shrimp with Broccoli in Garlic Sauce Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'fresh broccoli florets'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'peanut oil'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'low-sodium chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'oyster sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'grated fresh ginger root'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'canned water chestnuts, drained'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}]
directions: ['Combine broccoli and water in a glass bowl; steam in microwave oven until slightly tender, 2 to 3 minutes.', 'Heat peanut oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Reduce heat to low. Add chicken broth, soy sauce, oyster sauce, and ginger root to the garlic; bring to a boil. Add shrimp; cook and stir until the shrimp turn pink, 3 to 4 minutes.', 'Toss steamed broccoli and water chestnuts with shrimp mixture to coat with sauce. Stir cornstarch into mixture, 1 tablespoon at a time, until sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.']

title: Copycat Panda Express Chow Mein Recipe

title: Chicken in Black Bean Sauce Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'light soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'bean sprouts'}]
directions: ['To make the marinade: Mix 1 tablespoon cornstarch with 1 tablespoon water in a bowl; stir in light soy sauce, sugar, and salt. Add chicken; toss to combine. Set aside to marinate for 20 minutes.', 'Bring water to a boil in a saucepan. Add bean sprouts; cook just until blanched, about 30 seconds; drain and set aside.', 'Combine 1/4 cup water, oyster sauce, and sugar together in a small bowl; set aside.', 'Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over high heat. Add black bean sauce and chopped garlic; cook and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add onion; cook and stir until soft, 3 to 4 minutes.', 'Add chicken and marinade mixture; stir-fry until cooked through and no longer pink in the middle, about 4 to 5 minutes. Stir in oyster sauce mixture; cook until heated through. Cover and simmer until flavors blend, about 1 or 2 minutes. Stir in bell pepper; cover and cook until softened, 1 to 2 minutes more.', 'Dissolve 2 teaspoons cornstarch in 1 tablespoon water. Stir in bean sprouts and cornstarch mixture; cook until sauce is thickened, 2 to 3 minutes more.']

title: Quick Beef Stir-Fry Recipe

Continue to cook and stir until vegetables are tender, about 2 more minutes.', 'Serve hot and enjoy!']

title: Orange Chicken Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': '2 Â½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'orange juice'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'packed brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped green onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'grated orange zest'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'minced fresh ginger root'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'minced garlic'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'water'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Combine water, rice vinegar, lemon juice, soy sauce, and orange juice for sauce into a saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in brown sugar, green onion, orange zest, ginger, garlic, and pepper flakes; bring to a boil. Remove from heat, and cool for 10 to 15 minutes.', 'Place chicken in a resealable plastic bag. Pour in 1 cup cooled sauce. Seal the bag, and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Reserve the remaining sauce.', 'Mix flour, salt, and pepper in another resealable plastic bag.', 'Remove chicken from the marinade and place into the bag of seasoned flour. Seal the bag and shake to coat.', 'Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken in the hot skillet until browned on both sides.', 'Remove to a paper towel-lined plate and cover with aluminum foil. Wipe out the skillet.', 'Pour reserved sauce into the skillet and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Mix together cornstarch and water until completely smooth. Stir into the boiling sauce.', 'Reduce heat to medium-low, add the chicken, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until cooked through, about 5 minutes.', 'Serve over rice and enjoy!']

title: Perfect Pot Stickers recipes
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '32 pot stickers'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground pork'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'minced garlic'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped green onions'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'very finely minced fresh ginger'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'sesame oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'finely chopped green cabbage'}]
directions: ['To make the filling: Place ground pork, green onions, garlic, ginger, 2 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon soy sauce, sesame oil, and cayenne in a mixing bowl. Top with chopped green cabbage. Mix with fork until thoroughly combined. Tamp down lightly; cover with plastic. Refrigerate until chilled, about an hour.', 'To make the dough: Place 2 Â½ cups of flour and kosher salt in a mixing bowl. Slowly pour in hot water. Stir with a wooden spoon until mixture forms a shaggy dough. Flour your hands and transfer dough to a work surface. Knead dough until it becomes smooth and elastic, about 3 to 5 minutes. If dough seems too sticky, sprinkle with a bit more flour, up to an additional 1/2 cup, and continue to knead. Wrap dough ball in plastic, and let it rest about 30 minutes.', 'When dough has rested, divide into 4 equal pieces. Cover 3 pieces with a dish cloth while you work the first piece. Roll into a small log about the thickness of a thumb, about 3/4 inch. Divide each log into 6 equal pieces. Roll each piece into a thin 3 Â½-inch circle on a lightly floured surface to form the pot sticker wrappers. Repeat with the remaining dough pieces.', 'Lightly moisten the edges of a wrapper with your wet finger. Place a small scoop of the ground pork mixture onto the center of a wrapper. Fold up the 2 sides and pinch together in the center. Pinch together the remaining edges, forming "pleats" along one side. Tap the pot sticker on the work surface to slightly flatten the bottom; form a slight curve in it so it stands upright in the pan. Transfer to a well-floured plate. Repeat with remaining dough and filling.', 'To make the dipping sauce: Mix seasoned rice vinegar and soy sauce together in a small mixing bowl. Set aside.', 'Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Place about 6 or 7 pot stickers in the hot oil, flat-side down. Cook until bottoms are golden brown, about 2 minutes. Drizzle in water and quickly cover the pan; steam for 3 minutes. Uncover; reduce heat to medium. Continue cooking until water evaporates and bottoms are browned and crunchy, 1 or 2 minutes. Transfer to a warm serving dish. Repeat with remaining pot stickers.', 'Serve dumplings with dipping sauce.']

title: Pork Dumplings Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '100 pork dumplings'}]

Stir until well mixed.', 'Place 1 heaping teaspoon of pork filling onto each wonton skin. Moisten edges with water and fold edges over to form a triangle shape. Roll edges slightly to seal in filling. Set dumplings aside on a lightly floured surface until ready to cook.', "Arrange dumplings in a covered bamboo or metal steamer so they don't touch to prevent them from sticking together; steam until pork is cooked through, about 15 minutes.", 'Serve hot and enjoy!']

title: Super Easy Cabbage Stir Fry Recipe

title: Kung Pao Chicken Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]

Heat slowly over medium heat until aromatic.', 'Meanwhile, transfer chicken from marinade into a large skillet; cook over medium-high heat, stirring, until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear.', 'Combine water chestnut mixture and sautÃ©ed chicken together in one skillet. Adjust heat and simmer together until sauce thickens.']

title: Honey Walnut Shrimp Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': 'â…”', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'walnuts'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg whites'}, {'Quantity': 'â…”', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'mochiko (glutinous rice flour)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vegetable oil for frying'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'large shrimp, peeled and deveined'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'mayonnaise'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'honey'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'canned sweetened condensed milk'}]

Stir in mochiko until it has a pasty consistency.', 'Heat oil in a heavy deep skillet over medium-high heat. title: Sweet and Sour Pork Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'pork butt, cut into 1 inch cubes'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Place cubed pork in a medium bowl and season with soy sauce, salt, and sugar for marinade.', 'Add egg white and green onions and mix until well-combined. Cover and place in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.', 'Heat 1 quart oil to 365 degrees F (185 degrees C) in a large, heavy saucepan or deep fryer. Coat pork with cornstarch.', 'Fry in hot oil until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain on paper towels and set aside.', 'Heat oil for vegetables in a wok over medium heat. Cook until thickened and warmed through, about 2 minutes.']

title: Mongolian Beef and Spring Onions Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'finely chopped garlic'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'grated fresh ginger root'}, {'Quantity': 'â…”', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dark brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'beef flank steak, sliced 1/4 inch thick on the diagonal'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vegetable oil for frying'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'bunches', 'Name': 'green onions, cut in 2-inch lengths'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Heat 2 teaspoons of vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and ginger; cook and stir until fragrant, about 30 seconds.', 'Stir in brown sugar, soy sauce, and water.', 'Increase heat to medium-high; stir until sauce boils and slightly thickens, about 4 minutes. Remove sauce from the heat and set aside.', 'Place beef into a large bowl; add cornstarch and mix until beef is thoroughly coated.', 'Set aside until most of the cornstarch has been absorbed, about 10 minutes.', 'Heat vegetable oil in a deep skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Shake excess cornstarch from beef slices and drop into hot oil, a few at a time, stirring briefly and frying until edges become crisp, about 2 minutes.', 'Remove beef with a large slotted spoon; drain on paper towels.', 'Remove excess oil from the skillet, then heat the skillet over medium heat; add beef slices and stir in prepared sauce. title: Chinese Pork Dumplings Recipe
