title: Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cool Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '24 cookie bars'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'baking spray', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'baking spray'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2/3', 'Unit': 'cup packed', 'Name': 'light brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking soda'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'mini semisweet chocolate chips'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped walnuts'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Gather all ingredients.', 'Line bottom and sides of a 13x9-inch baking pan with heavy duty aluminum foil, leaving a 2-inch overhang on all sides, lightly spray with baking spray; set aside.', 'Beat together white sugar, brown sugar, and butter with a stand mixer fitted with paddle attachment on medium speed until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes, stopping to scrape down sides as needed.', 'With mixer running on low, add eggs, one at a time, beating until just combined after each addition. Beat in vanilla until just combined.', 'Whisk together flour, baking powder, salt, and baking soda in a medium bowl until combined. With stand mixer running on low speed, gradually beat in flour mixture until almost fully incorporated, about 2 minutes, stopping to scrape down sides as needed.', 'Stir in chocolate chips and toasted walnuts until combined.', 'Transfer dough into prepared baking pan, spreading into an even layer.', 'Bake in preheated oven until golden brown and set, about 40 minutes, rotating baking pan front to back halfway through.', 'Let cookie cool completely in pan on wire rack, about 1 hour. Using foil overhang as handles, lift cookie out of pan.', 'Cut into 24 (about 2-inch) squares.']

title: 4-Ingredient Nutter Butter Cookie Balls Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '20'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '20 cookie balls'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '16', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'peanut butter sandwich cookies (such as Nutter ButterÂ®)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) jar', 'Name': 'peanut butter (such as JifÂ®)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': '(24 ounce) package', 'Name': 'chocolate candy melts'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'multicolored candy sprinkles'}]
directions: ['Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.', 'Crush peanut butter cookies in a food processor until they are crumbs. Pour into the bowl of a stand mixer and add peanut butter. Mix on medium speed until a dough forms, about 5 minutes.', 'Scoop dough and form 20 balls, placing them onto the prepared baking sheet. Freeze for 30 minutes so they will hold together while dipping.', 'Melt chocolate candy in a microwave-safe bowl in a microwave, stirring frequently, in 30-second increments.', 'Insert a toothpick into each cookie ball and dip into melted chocolate. Return balls to the prepared baking sheet and top with sprinkles.']

title: Puppy Chow Crispy Treats
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Rest Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12 serving size: 1 (3-x-3.25-inch) piece'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': '72% dark chocolate chips'}, {'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'creamy peanut butter'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': 'ounce', 'Name': 'rice cereal squares'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'powdered sugar'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'miniature marshmallows'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'creamy peanut butter (such as Skippy)'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Place chocolate chips, 3/4 cup peanut butter, and 4 tablespoons butter in a large microwave-safe heatproof bowl. Microwave on HIGH until melted and smooth, stirring every 30 seconds, 1 1/2 to 2 minutes; stir in salt.', 'Place cereal into a very large bowl. Pour melted chocolate mixture over cereal; fold until cereal is evenly coated. Let rest for 15 minutes. Rinse and dry bowl used to melt chocolate mixture and set aside.', 'Add 1 cup powdered sugar to cereal mixture; fold until evenly coated (itâ€™s ok if some powdered sugar dissolves). Spread into an even layer on a large-rimmed, parchment-lined baking sheet and set aside. Rinse and dry bowl used to coat cereal mixture and set aside.', 'Place remaining 4 tablespoons butter and marshmallows in reserved large bowl. Microwave on HIGH until marshmallows have puffed and start turning into one mass, about 45 seconds. Stir well and add 2 tablespoons peanut butter. Microwave for 30 more seconds, and stir again until smooth. Place cereal mixture back into reserved very large bowl and pour marshmallow mixture over cereal. Quickly fold and stir until evenly coated.', 'Spray a 13-x 9-inch baking pan with cooking spray. Spread cereal mixture into pan, lightly pressing into an even layer; let sit at room temperature until set, about 1 hour.', 'Sift remaining 1 tablespoon powdered sugar over cereal mixture, cut into 12 (3-x-3.25- inch) pieces and serve.']

title: Easy Churro Cronuts Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(8 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'crescent dough sheets'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chocolate sauce or chocolate hazelnut spread for serving'}]
directions: ['Remove dough from each can and unroll to a rectangular shape. Fold the shorter end of 1 sheet up 1/3 of the way. Fold the opposite edge 1/3 of the way to fold over (and cover) the first fold. The dough should have 3 layers. Use a 3-inch cutter to cut 3 circles from the dough. Form the scraps into another layered piece and cut out one more circle. Repeat with the remaining dough sheet.\xa0 Use a smaller cutter to cut the center out of each circle to form a donut shape and reserve for donut holes.', 'Fill a large saucepan halfway with oil and place over medium-high heat to reach a temperature of 350 to 365 degrees F (175 to 183 degrees C). Line a tray with paper towels.', 'Combine sugar and cinnamon in a shallow dish; set aside.', 'Working with 2 to 3 cronuts at a time, carefully lower each cronut into the hot oil. Fry about 1 minute, rotating occasionally, until browned evenly. Drain briefly on the prepared tray. While donuts are still hot, coat evenly in cinnamon sugar. Repeat with remaining cronuts and doughnut holes.', 'Serve with chocolate sauce or hazelnut spread for dipping.']

title: Pecan Pie Upside Down Cake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cool Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'nonstick cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'light corn syrup'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla paste'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cinnamon'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'pecan halves'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Spray a 10-inch cake pan with nonstick cooking spray. Line with parchment paper and spray again. Set aside.', 'Place butter, brown sugar, corn syrup, vanilla paste, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Add pecans and stir until pecans are coated in mixture. Pour into prepared cake pan and set aside.', 'For cake batter, place cake mix, eggs, pudding mix, milk, oil, sour cream, and vanilla in a large bowl. Using an electric mixer, beat for 3 minutes. Pour over pecan mixture.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a skewer inserted in center comes out clean, 40 to 50 minutes.', 'Run a butter knife around outside of cake to release from pan. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Carefully flip cake onto a serving platter and cool completely before slicing.']

title: French Almond Rum Cake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cool Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'light brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'almond flour'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'rum'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'lemon zest'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'almond extract'}, {'Quantity': '3/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking powder'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Generously grease an 8-inch round cake pan with butter and line the bottom with parchment; then butter the parchment.', 'For cake, beat butter, brown sugar, white sugar, salt, and nutmeg together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Add in almond flour, and beat for 1 minute. Add in eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. After last egg has been incorporated, turn mixer speed to medium-high and beat batter for 3 minutes.', 'Add in 1/4 cup rum, lemon zest, vanilla, and almond extract and mix until combined. Reduce mixer speed to low, add in flour and baking powder and mix until just incorporated. Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth into an even layer.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until cake is browned and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 45 to 50 minutes. Cool cake in pan for 10 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, prepare the syrup. Place water and sugar in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until sugar is dissolved and mixture is simmering, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove pan from heat and stir in rum. Put pan back over medium-low heat and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Remove pan from heat.', 'Invert cake onto a wire rack and remove parchment. Leave cake inverted and brush warm syrup over warm cake until all syrup is absorbed. Allow cake to cool completely, about 30 minutes.', 'For icing, whisk together lemon juice, powdered sugar, pinch of salt, and heavy cream until smooth and combined. If necessary, add extra lemon juice or heavy cream to thin icing to a pourable, but not too thin, consistency.', 'Place cooled cake onto a serving platter. Pour icing evenly over the cake. Use a spatula or offset knife to smooth over the top if necessary. Sprinkle toasted sliced almonds over icing. Allow icing to set for several minutes before cutting and serving.']

title: Copycat Trader Joe's Gone Bananas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Freeze Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '18'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'banana'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'dark chocolate chips'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'unsalted butter'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}]
directions: ['Line a baking sheet with parchment. Slice banana into 1/4-inch thick rounds. Place rounds onto the lined sheet, then place into the freezer. Freeze until solid, about 2 hours.', 'Place chocolate chips, butter, and oil in a small microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on 50% power for 1 to 2 minutes, stopping to stir every 30 seconds, until chocolate is melted.', 'Remove banana rounds from freezer. Place one round onto a fork and dip into the chocolate until fully coated. Shake to remove excess chocolate, then use another fork to help slide the chocolate covered banana round back onto the parchment lined baking sheet. Repeat process until all banana pieces are coated in chocolate.', 'Place chocolate covered banana pieces back into the freezer until chocolate is set, about 30 minutes. Keep stored in the freezer.']

title: No-Bake Nutter Butter Banana Pudding Cheesecake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Chill Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '20', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'Nutter Butter sandwich cookies'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter, melted'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(8-ounce packages)', 'Name': 'cream cheese, softened'}, {'Quantity': '1 (', 'Unit': '8-ounce) can', 'Name': 'sweetened condensed milk'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'heavy whipping cream, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '3.4 ounce) package', 'Name': 'vanilla instant pudding mix'}, {'Quantity': '1/2 (', 'Unit': '3.4 ounce) package', 'Name': 'banana instant pudding mix'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '1/8', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bananas, thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'peanut butter, plus more for topping'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'powdered sugar'}]
directions: ['Pulse cookies in a food processor until finely crushed.\xa0Add melted butter and pulse just until combined.\xa0Press mixture into the bottom of a 9 inch spring form pan.\xa0Freeze crust while filling is prepared.', 'In a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, beat cream cheese until light and fluffy.\xa0Add in sweetened condensed milk and 1 1/2 cups cream and beat until smooth, scraping down the sides of the bowl as necessary.\xa0Add in pudding mixes, vanilla, and salt and blend until smooth and well combined.\xa0Mixture will be very thick.', 'Spread half of the pudding mixture into the pan over the crust.\xa0Add banana slices in an even layer over pudding mixture.\xa0Melt peanut butter for about 15 seconds in the microwave and drizzle evenly over the banana slices.\xa0Top with remaining pudding mixture and spread into an even layer.\xa0Refrigerate for 2 hours and up to overnight.', 'Whip remaining cream and powdered sugar together until soft peaks form.\xa0Serve cheesecake topped with\xa0 whipped cream.\xa0Top with half of a cookie and more melted peanut butter if desired.']

title: Mutton Varuval (Malaysian Indian-Style Goat Curry) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '3 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'goat stew meat, cut into chunks'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'salt, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric, divided'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'red onions, quartered'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'coconut oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cinnamon stick, broken into pieces'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'whole star anise pods'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cardamom pods'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'fennel seeds'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'whole cloves'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'curry leaves, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ginger-garlic paste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'tomato, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'coconut oil'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'garam masala'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground paprika'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}]
directions: ['Season goat meat with 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric, and black pepper.', 'Place red onions in a blender; grind into a smooth paste.', 'Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons coconut oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Add cinnamon stick, star anise, and cardamom pods; cook until aromatic, about 30 seconds. Add fennel and cloves; cook and stir for 30 seconds. Add remaining 1 teaspoon salt and 1 tablespoon curry leaves; stir in the onion paste. Increase heat to medium-high. Cook and stir curry mixture for 5 minutes; add ginger-garlic paste and continue cooking until flavors meld, about 10 minutes.', 'Stir diced tomato into the curry mixture. Cook and stir until mushy, about 4 minutes. Add the seasoned goat meat; cook until browned, 6 to 10 minutes. Transfer goat curry to a slow cooker; cook on High until meat is tender, 2 to 3 hours.', 'Heat 1 teaspoon coconut oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir the remaining 1/2 teaspoon turmeric, garam masala, curry powder, and paprika until aromatic, about 1 minute. Add a few cups of the curry from the slow cooker; heat until oil rises to the top. Add remaining 1 tablespoon curry leaves and cilantro; cook until gravy thickens, 3 to 5 minutes. Pour back into the slow cooker and blend well.']

title: Banana Malpua (Fried Indian Pancake for Diwali) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'pods', 'Name': 'green cardamom, crushed, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'saffron strands, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'ripe bananas'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'semolina flour (suji)'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'sweetened condensed milk'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground fennel seeds (saunf)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'baking soda (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sunflower oil'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'ghee (clarified butter)'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'slivered almonds, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'raisins, or more to taste'}]
directions: ['Heat milk in a small saucepan over medium heat until it begins to bubble. Remove from heat and keep warm.', 'Bring 1 1/2 cups sugar and water to a boil in another saucepan. Add cardamom and saffron. Boil until syrup is thick and sticky, 4 to 7 minutes. Pour syrup into a bowl and place it over warm water to keep warm.', 'Blend warmed milk, remaining 1/2 cup sugar, bananas, flour, semolina, condensed milk, fennel, salt, and baking soda in a food processor until smooth, not be too thick or too runny. Cover and let rest, at least 30 minutes and up to 4 hours.', 'Heat oil and ghee in a nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low. Drop 1 large spoonful of batter into the center to make a 2-inch pancake. Cook until edges turn golden brown, about 2 minutes. Flip and fry until both sides are golden, 1 to 2 minutes more. Remove with a slotted spoon and let cool. Repeat with remaining batter.', 'Dunk cooled pancakes into the syrup, one by one. Garnish with almonds and raisins.']

title: Gajar Ka Halwa (Carrot Halwa)
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'ghee or oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'carrots, grated'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'quarts', 'Name': 'whole milk'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'raisins or sultanas'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'saffron threads'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped pistachio nuts'}]
directions: ['Heat ghee in a large saucepan over medium heat and add carrots. Cook and stir briefly, about 3 minutes. Pour in milk and increase heat; bring to a boil and cook, stirring constantly, for 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low and simmer gently, uncovered, and stirring occasionally until moisture evaporates, about 1 hour.', 'Bring carrot mixture back to a boil; add sugar, raisins, cardamom, and saffron. Cook and stir until mixture has thickened, about 10 minutes.', 'Ladle carrot halwa into 8 individual serving dishes. Top each serving with 1 tablespoon pistachios. Serve warm or chill before serving.']

title: Chicken Biryani Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil, divided'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'potatoes, peeled and halved'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onions, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'minced fresh ginger root'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'medium tomatoes, peeled and chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cumin'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'plain yogurt'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped fresh mint leaves'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(2 inch) piece', 'Name': 'cinnamon stick'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'boneless, skinless chicken pieces cut into chunks'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet. Fry potatoes in hot oil until lightly browned, about 3 to 5 minutes. Remove to a paper towel-lined plate to drain; set aside.', 'Add remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the skillet. Add onions, garlic, and fresh ginger; cook and stir until onion is soft and golden. Add tomatoes, salt, cumin, chili powder, pepper, and turmeric; cook, stirring constantly, for 5 minutes.', 'Stir in yogurt, mint, ground cardamom, and cinnamon stick. Cover and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes are cooked to a pulp. It may be necessary to add a little hot water if mixture becomes too dry and starts to stick to the pan.', 'Add chicken and stir well to coat. Cover and cook over very low heat until chicken is tender, 35 to 45 minutes. There should only be a little very thick gravy left when chicken is finished cooking. If necessary cook uncovered for a few minutes to reduce the gravy.', 'Meanwhile, make the rice: Wash rice well and drain in a colander for at least 30 minutes.', 'Heat oil in a large skillet. Add onion; cook and stir until golden. Add cardamom pods, cloves, cinnamon stick, ground ginger, and saffron; stir in rice until coated with spices.', 'Heat stock and salt in a medium pot until hot; pour over rice and stir well.', 'Add chicken mixture and potatoes; stir gently to combine. Bring to a boil.', 'Reduce heat to very low, cover with a tight-fitting lid, and steam for 20 minutes without lifting the lid or stirring.', 'Spoon biryani onto a warm serving dish.']

title: Crispy Vegetable Pakoras Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chickpea flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garam masala'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'quart', 'Name': 'oil for deep frying'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'head', 'Name': 'cauliflower florets'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'onions, sliced into rings'}]
directions: ['Sift chickpea flour into a medium bowl; mix in garlic, salt, coriander, turmeric, chili powder, and garam masala. Make a well in the center; gradually pour water into the well and mix to form a thick, smooth batter.', 'Heat oil in a large heavy saucepan over medium-high heat to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).', 'While the oil is heating, dip cauliflower florets and onion rings in batter to coat.', 'Working in small batches, fry battered vegetables in hot oil until golden brown, about 4 to 5 minutes. Drain on paper towels before serving.']

title: Air Fryer Pakoras Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chopped cauliflower'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chickpea flour (besan)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced yellow potatoes'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'curry powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'coriander'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cayenne pepper, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cumin'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}]
directions: ['Mix together cauliflower, chickpea flour, potatoes, water, red onion, salt, garlic, curry powder, coriander, cayenne pepper, and cumin in a large bowl until well combined. Set batter aside to rest for 10 minutes.', 'Preheat the air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease the basket of the air fryer with cooking spray.', 'Spoon 2 tablespoons batter into the prepared basket and flatten. Repeat this as many times as the basket space allows without the pakoras touching. Mist the top of each pakora with cooking spray.', 'Cook in the preheated air fryer for 8 minutes. Flip and cook for 8 more minutes. Transfer pakoras to a paper towel-lined plate. Repeat steps 3 and 4 with remaining batter.']

title: Baked Onion Bhajis Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 bhajis'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'extra-virgin olive oil, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'onions, thinly sliced'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper.', 'Cook the onions: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions; cook and stir until translucent, 6 to 8 minutes. Mix in chili powder, then stir in turmeric, coriander, cumin, and ginger until well combined. Remove from the heat.', 'Make the batter: Mix chickpea flour, cumin, coriander, and salt together in a bowl until well combined. Mix in onions and tomato purÃ©e, then add a little water until mixture is wet and easy to stir.', 'Drizzle 1 teaspoon olive oil onto the prepared baking sheet. Place 2 tablespoons onion mixture onto the baking sheet for each bhaji; flatten slightly with the back of a spoon.', 'Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes. Drizzle remaining oil over the bhajis and continue baking until golden brown, about 25 more minutes.']

title: Dal Makhani (Indian Lentils) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '4 hrs 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'lentils'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dry kidney beans (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'water to cover'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cumin seeds'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cardamom pods'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cinnamon stick, broken'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaves'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'whole cloves'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'ginger paste'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'garlic paste'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'canned tomato puree, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'ground coriander'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'dried fenugreek leaves (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cream (Optional)'}]
directions: ['Place lentils and kidney beans in a large bowl; cover with plenty of water. Soak for at least 2 hours or overnight. Drain.', 'Cook lentils, kidney beans, 5 cups water, and salt in a pot over medium heat until tender, stirring occasionally, about 1 hour. Remove from heat and set aside. Keep the lentils, kidney beans, and any excess cooking water in the pot.', 'Heat vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook cumin seeds in the hot oil until they begin to pop, 1 to 2 minutes. Add cardamom pods, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, and cloves; cook until bay leaves turn brown, about 1 minute. Reduce heat to medium-low; add ginger paste, garlic paste, turmeric, and cayenne pepper. Stir to coat.', 'Stir tomato puree into spice mixture; cook over medium heat until slightly reduced, about 5 minutes. Add chili powder, coriander, and butter; cook and stir until butter is melted.', 'Stir lentils, kidney beans and any leftover cooking water into tomato mixture; bring to a boil, reduce heat to low. Stir fenugreek into lentil mixture. Cover saucepan and simmer until heated through, stirring occasionally, about 45 minutes. Add cream and cook until heated through, 2 to 4 minutes.']

title: Gulab Jamun Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '20'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '20 balls'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dry milk powder'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'ghee (clarified butter), melted'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'warm milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chopped almonds (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'chopped pistachio nuts (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'golden raisins (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'quart', 'Name': 'vegetable oil for deep frying'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': 'fluid ounces', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'rose water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}]
directions: ['In a large bowl, stir together the milk powder, flour, baking powder, and cardamom. Stir in the almonds, pistachios and golden raisins. Mix in the melted ghee, then pour in the milk, and continue to mix until well blended. Cover and let rest for 20 minutes.', 'In a large skillet, stir together the sugar, water, rose water and a pinch of cardamom. Bring to a boil, and simmer for just a minute. Set aside.', 'Fill a large heavy skillet halfway with oil. Heat over medium heat for at least 5 minutes. Knead the dough, and form into about 20 small balls. Reduce the heat of the oil to low, and fry the balls in one or two batches. After about 5 minutes, they will start to float, and expand to twice their original size, but the color will not change much. After the jamun float, increase the heat to medium, and turn them frequently until light golden. Remove from the oil to paper towels using a slotted spoon, and allow to cool. Drain on paper towels and allow to cool slightly.', 'Place the balls into the skillet with the syrup. Simmer over medium heat for about 5 minutes, squeezing them gently to soak up the syrup. Serve immediately, or chill.']

title: Samosas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '30'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '30 samosas'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'quart', 'Name': 'oil for deep frying'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green chile peppers, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'fresh ginger root, chopped'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground turmeric'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground lamb'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'garam masala'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'fresh lemon juice'}]
directions: ['In a medium bowl, mix flour, salt and butter until the mixture resembles fine bread crumbs. Pour in water, using more (up to approximately 1/4 cup) if necessary to make a smooth dough. Pat into a ball. Place on a lightly floured surface and knead 10 minutes, or until dough is smooth and elastic. Return to the bowl, cover and set aside.', 'Heat oil in a large, deep skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).', 'Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium high heat. Stir in onion, garlic, green chile peppers and ginger. Cook 5 minutes, or until onions are golden brown. Stir in turmeric, chili powder, ground lamb and salt. Cook until the lamb meat is evenly brown, about 10 minutes. Stir in garam masala and lemon juice. Continue cooking 5 minutes, then remove from heat.', 'Divide dough into 15 equal portions. Roll portions into balls, then flatten into 4 inch circles. Cut each circle in half. Dampen edges and form semicircles into cones. Fill cones with equal portions of the lamb meat mixture. Dampen top and bottom edges of cones, and pinch to seal.', 'Carefully lower cones into preheated oil a few at a time. Fry until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Serve warm.']

title: Lamb (Gosht) Biryani Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'basmati rice'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cooking oil'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'whole cloves'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'black cardamom pods'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cinnamon sticks'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onions, sliced thin'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'garlic paste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'ginger paste'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped fresh cilantro leaves'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped fresh mint leaves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'lamb chops'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'tomatoes, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green chile peppers, halved lengthwise'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'ground red pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'plain yogurt'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}, {'Quantity': '7 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, sliced'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'saffron'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'warm milk'}]
directions: ['Place basmati rice in a large container and cover with several inches of cool water; let stand 30 minutes. Drain.', 'Heat 1/4 cup oil in a large skillet over medium heat; add cloves, cardamom pods, and cinnamon sticks and cook in the hot oil until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add onions; cook and stir until onions are lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Stir garlic paste and ginger paste into onion mixture; cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Sprinkle cilantro and mint over onion mixture and cook 1 minute more.', 'Add lamb chops to the skillet; season with salt. Cook lamb until chops are browned on both sides, about 20 minutes.', 'Stir in tomatoes, green chile peppers, and ground red pepper; continue cooking until oil begins to separate from the sauce, about 10 minutes. Add yogurt and lemon juice; cover and cook until the lamb is tender, about 15 minutes. Add some water as needed to keep mixture from getting too dry.', 'Place rice, 7 Â½ cups water, and 1 teaspoon salt in a saucepan; bring to a boil and simmer until rice is nearly done yet a little chewy, 10 to 15 minutes. Drain any excess water.', 'Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a small skillet; add sliced onion and cook until lightly browned.', 'Layer about Â½ of the rice in the bottom of a deep pot with a lid. Spoon the lamb masala mixture over the rice. Spread fried onion over lamb masala. Top with remaining rice.', 'Stir saffron and warm milk together in a small bowl; pour over top layer of rice. Cover the pot with the lid and place the pot over low heat; cook until the rice is thoroughly cooked, about 15 minutes.']

title: Shahi Tukra (Indian Bread Pudding) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '8 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'quart', 'Name': 'oil for deep frying'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'white bread, crusts removed and cut into 4 squares'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cashews'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sliced almonds'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'pistachio nuts'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'whole milk'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'evaporated milk'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'saffron'}]
directions: ['Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Fry the bread slices in the hot oil until deep, golden brown; drain on a plate lined with paper towels. Fry the cashews, almonds, and pistachio nuts in the hot oil until golden brown; remove from oil and set aside to cool. Chop roughly.', 'Bring the milk to a gentle boil in a heavy-bottomed pan over medium-low heat; continue boiling until the volume of milk reduces by about half. Pour the evaporated milk into the pan and add the sugar, cardamom, and saffron; simmer together 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool completely.', 'Arrange the fried bread pieces in a shallow dish large enough to allow them to be laid in a single layer. Evenly pour the milk mixture over the bread. Scatter the chopped nuts over the bread. Chill in refrigerator until completely cold, 1 to 2 hours.']

title: Chef John's Tandoori Chicken Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lime, juiced'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'plain yogurt'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'tandoori masala powder'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'boneless, skinless chicken thighs'}]
directions: ['Whisk lime juice, yogurt, tandoori powder, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Pour mixture into a resealable plastic bag. Add chicken, coat with the marinade, squeeze out excess air, and seal the bag. Marinate in refrigerator for at least 2 hours.', 'Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat, and lightly oil the grate.', 'Remove chicken from the bag and transfer to a plate or baking sheet lined with paper towels. Pat chicken pieces dry with more paper towels.', 'Grill chicken on the preheated grill with the lid open for 2 minutes. Close lid and continue to grill chicken for 6 minutes.', 'Turn chicken, close lid and grill until well-browned and meat is no longer pink in the center, about 6 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh should read 180 degrees F (82 degrees C).']

title: Easy Malai Kulfi Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '3 cups'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'whole milk'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'condensed milk'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'dry milk powder'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'white sugar, or to taste (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'saffron threads'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped pistachio nuts'}]
directions: ['Stir the milk, condensed milk, and dry milk powder together in a heavy-bottomed pan and bring to a boil. Add the sugar, cardamom, and saffron to the boiling milk; reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring frequently, for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool to room temperature; fold the pistachio nuts into the mixture.', 'Pour the mixture into popsicle molds and freeze until solid, about 1 hour']

title: Green Chutney Recipe
