title: Bourbon Slush with Drunken Cherries Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Freeze Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Stand Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs 45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(1x3-inch)', 'Name': ''}, {'Quantity': '2 1/2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'bourbon'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'frozen pitted dark sweet cherries or pitted fresh cherries'}]
directions: ['For drunken cherries, combine brown sugar and orange peel in a pint-size canning jar. Muddle until peel releases oils. Add 1/2 cup bourbon and the vanilla. Cover and shake vigorously until sugar dissolves. Add cherries; cover and shake gently to combine. Chill at least 8 hours (and up to 1 year).', 'Meanwhile, bring 3 cups water to a boil in a saucepan. Remove from heat. Add tea bags. Steep according to package directions. Remove and discard tea bags. Add white sugar; stir to dissolve. Let cool.', 'Pour tea mixture and remaining 3 cups water into an extra-large pitcher or freezer-safe container. Add lemonade and orange juice concentrates; stir until combined. Stir in remaining 2 cups bourbon. Freeze until almost firm, 8 to 12 hours. (Freeze in an airtight container up to 1 year.)', 'When ready to serve, let frozen tea mixture stand at room temperature until partially thawed and slushy, 15 to 30 minutes. Stir well, then spoon into glasses. Garnish with drunken cherries and orange slices. Serve immediately.']

title: Salted Grapefruit Fizz Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 day 1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 cups'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'ruby grapefruit, zested and juiced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'lime juice'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}]
directions: ['To make the salted grapefruit cordial: Remove strips of zest from 1 ruby grapefruit with a vegetable peeler, avoiding any white pith. Stir grapefruit zest and sugar together in a jar. Chill, covered, for 24 hours.', 'Squeeze juice from the grapefruit and measure out 1/2 cup juice. Pour 1/2 cup grapefruit juice, fresh lime juice, and water over the sugar mixture in the jar. Stir in kosher salt. Stir or shake mixture to dissolve sugar. Strain out zest; chill for 1 hour or cover and keep chilled for up to 3 days.', 'To make the punch: Combine salted grapefruit cordial, grapefruit juice, and lime juice in a punch bowl. Chill until ready to serve; pour in club soda before serving with citrus ice ring, if using.', 'To make a citrus ice ring: Fill an ice ring mold with very thin half slices of grapefruit and very thin slices of lime. Fill ring halfway with water; freeze until firm, about 30 minutes. Add more water to fill mold, freeze until firm, about 2 hours.']

title: Honey-Chamomile Prosecco Cocktail Recipe

Add chopped apple, prosecco, and sparkling water to pitcher just before serving.']

title: Coffee Grounds Liqueur Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Stand Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '8 hrs 5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '7'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'leftover coffee grounds'}, {'Quantity': '2/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'stick', 'Name': 'cinnamon stick'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla bean paste'}, {'Quantity': '2/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'boiling water'}, {'Quantity': '2/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white rum'}]

title: Top Tips for Making a Perfect Cappuccino at Home Every Time Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '1'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'ground espresso'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'whole milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'ground cinnamon'}]
directions: ['Gather the ingredients.', 'Fill espresso machine reservoir with water.', 'Spoon ground espresso into portafilter.', 'â€œTampâ€ or press coffee grounds down using a tamper. Do this 2 to 3 times to make sure grounds are packed tightly.', "Place portafilter into your espresso machine's group head, and lock it in place.", 'Place your drinking vessel under the portafilter, and pull the shot for 23 to 30 seconds (you should have 2 ounces of espresso for a double shot).', 'Pour milk into either a glass measuring cup or a small metal pitcher. Insert steam wand into container with milk, just under the surface of the milk. Keeping the wand toward the side of the container, move the container up and down so that the wand can incorporate air into the milk. Steam milk until doubled in volume and very foamy, about 20 seconds. Swirl frothed milk a couple of times to incorporate foam into milk.', 'Immediately top espresso with foamed milk, and sprinkle with cinnamon. When initially poured, cappuccino is only espresso and foam, but the liquid milk quickly settles out of the foam to create the roughly equal parts foam, steamed milk, and espresso.']

title: Thai Spice Sweet Tea Recipe

title: Tomato Soup and Grilled Cheese Casserole Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': '(1/2-inch thick) slices', 'Name': 'sourdough bread (about 20 ounces)'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'cream cheese'}, {'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'Cheddar cheese'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(10.75-ounce) cans', 'Name': "condensed tomato soup (such as Campbell's)"}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'tomato juice'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'Italian seasoning'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'Roma tomato'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'shredded Italian blend or Cheddar cheese'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.', 'Spread 6 slices of bread with 2 tablespoons butter on one side.', 'Lay buttered slices of bread, butter side down, on an extra large baking sheet.', 'Spread bread slices evenly with cream cheese.', 'Top each bread slice with 2 slices of Cheddar cheese', 'Top cheese with remaining bread slices.', 'Spread tops of bread slices with 2 tablespoons butter.', 'Bake sandwiches for 12 to 14 minutes, flipping once, until cheese is melted. Let sandwiches cool at least 15 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Meanwhile, prepare soup mixture. Stir in chopped tomato.', 'Cut toasted sandwiches into 1-inch cubes.', 'Pour soup mixture into prepared dish.', 'Place cubes evenly over soup mixture in dish; pressing slightly to submerge in soup mixture.', 'Sprinkle with shredded Italian blend cheese.', 'Bake until heated through, golden brown, and cheese is melted, 25 to 30 minutes.']

title: Fiesta Tater Tot Casserole Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]

title: Catherine's Spicy Chicken Soup Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'quarts', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken breast halves'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'dried parsley'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'onion powder'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'cubes', 'Name': 'chicken bouillon'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) jar', 'Name': 'chunky salsa'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(14.5 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'peeled and diced tomatoes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(14.5 ounce) can', 'Name': 'whole peeled tomatoes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(10.5 ounce) can', 'Name': 'condensed tomato soup (such as Campbellâ€™s)'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chili powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'whole kernel corn, drained'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'chili beans, undrained'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(8 ounce) container', 'Name': 'sour cream'}]

title: Baguette Pizza Recipe

title: Hidden Veggie Meatloaf Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'lean ground beef'}, {'Quantity': 'â…”', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground turkey'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped celery'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'regular rolled oats'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'skim milk'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'ketchup'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped onion'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped green bell pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'dried parsley'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'dry mustard powder'}, {'Quantity': 'â…”', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'minced garlic'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}]

title: Pizza Boats Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '12 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '22 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 pizza boats'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(8-inch)', 'Name': 'hoagie rolls'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'talian seasoning'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'pizza sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'shredded mozzarella cheese'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': 'pepperoni, halved'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'grape tomatoes, halved'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tsp', 'Name': 'crushed red pepper flakes (optional)'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place a piece of aluminum foil on a baking sheet; set aside.', 'Slice each hoagie roll in half lengthwise to form two rolls, and using your fingertips, hollow out some of the bread inside, forming a well. Layer pepperoni and grape tomatoes on top of the cheese, sprinkle with red pepper flakes, and season to taste with salt. Place rolls on the prepared baking sheet.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is turning golden brown and starting to bubble, 12 to 14 minutes. Serve warm.']

title: Frito Pie Casserole Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground chuck'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped yellow onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'low-sodium chicken stock'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'red kidney beans, drained and rinsed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'diced tomatoes, undrained'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'sweet whole kernel corn, drained'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(1 ounce) envelope', 'Name': 'taco seasoning mix'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chipotle chile pepper in adobo sauce, finely chopped, plus 1 tablespoon adobo sauce'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'sharp Cheddar cheese, shredded, divided'}, {'Quantity': '2Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'corn chips (such as Fritos)'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sliced scallions, for garnish'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'sour cream, guacamole, and salsa, for serving'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground chuck, and cook, stirring and breaking up meat into smaller pieces with a wooden spoon, until browned and almost cooked through, 5 to 7 minutes. Add onion and bell pepper; cook, stirring often, until beef is cooked through and onion is softened, about 4 minutes.', 'Stir in stock, kidney beans, diced tomatoes, corn, taco seasoning, chipotle chile, and adobo sauce. Bring to a boil over medium-high. Reduce heat to medium, and simmer, stirring often, until slightly thickened, 7 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat, and stir in 1 cup of the Cheddar.', 'Transfer beef mixture to a 9 x 13-inch baking dish, and spread in an even layer. Top evenly with remaining Cheddar, and sprinkle evenly with corn chips.', 'Bake, uncovered, in the preheated oven until mixture is bubbling and Cheddar cheese is melted and starting to brown, 18 to 20 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes. Garnish with scallions, and serve with sour cream, guacamole, and salsa.']

title: Scrambled Egg Muffin Cups Recipe

title: Hash Brown and Bacon Omelet Cups Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cooking spray'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'frozen shredded hash brown potatoes, thawed'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter, melted'}, {'Quantity': '1/8', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1/8', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'shredded Mexican-style four-cheese blend'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs, lightly beaten'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'red bell pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'crushed red pepper (optional)'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'slices', 'Name': ''}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': 'chopped fresh', 'Name': 'chives, for garnish'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). title: Easy Pancakes Recipe (with Video)

directions: ['Gather the ingredients.', 'Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. Make a well in the center, and pour in milk, oil, and egg. title: Japanese Tamago Egg Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '1/4', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'prepared dashi stock'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'mirin (Japanese sweet wine)'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil, or more as needed'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Beat eggs thoroughly in a bowl; whisk in dashi stock, sugar, mirin, and soy sauce until sugar has dissolved. Lightly grease a nonstick skillet and heat over medium heat.', 'Pour a thin layer of egg mixture into the hot pan and swirl to coat the pan. Cook until egg layer is firm on the bottom but still slightly liquid on top, about 1 minute.', 'Then lift up one edge using a spatula and roll up the egg layer.', 'Push omelet roll to one side of the skillet. Oil the skillet again and pour in another thin layer of egg, lifting the first omelet roll up slightly to allow the egg to flow underneath.', 'Roll up the first omelet in the new layer of egg and push omelet to the edge of the skillet as before.', 'Repeat the process with the remaining egg mixture, oiling the pan each time if needed.', 'Remove rolled omelet to a serving platter and cut into 6 equal pieces to serve.']

title: Pecan Pie Bars Recipe

ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'butter or margarine'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'light corn syrup'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter or margarine, melted'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '2 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chopped pecans'}]
directions: ['Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 10x15-inch jellyroll pan.', 'Combine flour, 1/2 cup sugar, and salt in a large bowl. Cut in 1 cup of butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Sprinkle mixture evenly over the prepared pan and press in firmly to make a crust. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, mix corn syrup, 1 Â½ cups sugar, eggs, 3 tablespoons melted butter, and vanilla together in a large bowl until smooth. Stir in chopped pecans; spread filling evenly over baked crust as soon as it comes out of the oven.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until filling is set, about 25 minutes. Allow to cool completely in the pan on a wire rack before slicing into bars.']

title: Porcupine Meatballs Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 meatballs'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'lean ground beef'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'uncooked long grain white rice'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'kosher salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'celery salt'}, {'Quantity': 'â…›', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': 'â…›', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'canola oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(15 ounce) can', 'Name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'low sodium chicken stock, or more as needed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'granulated sugar'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Mix ground beef, rice, water, onion, salt, celery salt, garlic powder, and black pepper thoroughly in a bowl until well combined. Roll mixture into 12 meatballs.', 'Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Place meatballs into the hot skillet; cook, turning once halfway through cooking, until well browned, about 8 minutes. Drain and discard excess grease.', 'Pour tomato sauce, chicken stock, Worcestershire sauce, and sugar into the skillet; reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer until meatballs are no longer pink in the center and rice is tender, about 45 minutes. Stir in more stock if sauce becomes too dry.', 'Enjoy!']

title: Simple Strawberry Syrup Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '15'}]

directions: ['Combine water and sugar in a saucepan over medium-high heat; stir until sugar is dissolved. Mix strawberries into saucepan and bring to a boil; boil for 10 minutes.', 'Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer until strawberries are mushy and sauce is thick, about 10 minutes. Strain liquid into a bottle and refrigerate.']

title: Wacky Cake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 (8x8-inch) cake'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'unsweetened cocoa powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'baking soda'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cider vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Sift flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt together in an 8x8-inch ungreased cake pan. Make 3 depressions in flour mixture; pour oil into one well, vinegar into second, and vanilla into third well. Pour water over all, then stir with a fork until well blended.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 30 to 40 minutes.']

title: Dill Dip Recipe

title: Chicken Adobo Tacos Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Marinate Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1/3', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaves'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'granulated garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1 1/2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'skinless, boneless chicken thighs'}]
directions: ['Combine soy sauce, vinegar, bay leaves, and garlic in a large plastic bag with a zipper. Gently squeeze to mix well. Add chicken and coat with marinade. Squeeze out as much air from the bag as possible, coat all the chicken pieces with marinade, seal, and refrigerate for at least 20 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, combine vinegar, fish sauce, avocado oil, sugar, and black pepper in a bowl for the salsa. Stir with a whisk or fork until sugar is dissolved. Add mango, tomato, red onion, jalapeÃ±o, and chopped cilantro to the bowl. Toss to combine, and refrigerate salsa until ready to serve.', 'For tacos, remove chicken pieces from the marinade and reserve the marinade.', 'Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Carefully add the chicken thighs, and brown on each side, 1 to 2 minutes, then remove chicken to a plate.', 'To the same skillet, add onion, and cook for about 1 minute. Stir in minced garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add reserved marinade, water, brown sugar, and black pepper, and bring to a boil.', 'Return chicken to the skillet, smooth side down. Reduce heat to low, and simmer chicken uncovered, about 15 minutes. The liquid should bubble gently. Turn chicken and simmer 10 minutes more. Remove chicken from skillet to rest.', 'Cook sauce over medium heat until syrupy, thick, and reduced, about 10 minutes. Remove skillet from heat. Remove bay leaves and discard.', 'Slice chicken into 1/2-inch slices and return to the skillet to coat in the sauce. Garnish with fresh cilantro and chopped green onions, if desired.', 'Fill each tortilla with chicken strips and top with mango salsa. Serve immediately.']

title: Roscoe's Chicken Adobo Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'whole chicken,', 'Name': 'chicken'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'cloves garlic'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chunked'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'leaf', 'Name': 'bay leaves'}, {'Quantity': '1/2', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'light brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'peppercorns'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'steamed rice for serving'}]
directions: ['Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Cook chicken pieces until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes per side.', 'Add garlic, onion, bay leaves, brown sugar, soy sauce, vinegar, water, and peppercorns. Stir and bring to a nice simmer.', 'Cover with lid and simmer over medium heat for 15 minutes. Remove the lid and simmer for another 15 minutes.', 'Serve with rice.']

title: Maja Blanca Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 (8-inch) pudding'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(14-ounce) can', 'Name': 'full-fat unsweetened coconut milk (5 - 20% fat)'}]
directions: ['Gather ingredients.', 'To make the latik: Bring coconut milk to a boil in a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Continue to boil, stirring occasionally, until oil begins to separate from the milk, about 5 minutes.', 'Reduce heat to medium. Continue to cook, scraping the bottom of the skillet regularly with a heatproof spatula until only golden brown residue and oil is left, about 15 minutes. It will look a bit like ground meat, this is normal.', 'Strain mixture to separate coconut solids from the oil. The coconut solids are the latik and will be served with the pudding. Reserve the oil for another use. Cover and chill the latik until serving time.', 'Line an 8-inch square baking pan with parchment paper, extending the paper up two sides of the pan. Set aside.', 'To make the pudding: Whisk sugar and cornstarch together in a medium saucepan.', 'Stir in coconut cream, cream-style corn, and corn kernels, if using. Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring constantly, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium. Continue to cook and stir until mixture is thick and bubbly, 2 minutes.', 'Pour corn mixture into the prepared pan. Cover and refrigerate until chilled, at least 2 hours or up to 24 hours before serving.', 'Invert pudding carefully onto a serving plate. Remove parchment and discard. Cut into 12 slices. Remove latik from the refrigerator. Chop finely, if desired. Sprinkle latik over each slice.']

title: Pandan Chiffon Cake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '8'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 (9-inch) chiffon cake'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs, separated'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cream of tartar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '8', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'pandan paste'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'corn oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'self-rising flour, sifted'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).', 'Combine egg whites and cream of tartar in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment; beat egg whites until stiff peaks form.', 'Beat egg yolks and sugar in a separate bowl until sugar has dissolved.', 'Whisk water and pandan paste until smooth; mix thoroughly into egg yolk mixture. Stir in corn oil, then fold in sifted flour.', 'Fold egg yolk mixture gently into beaten egg whites using a spatula. Pour into a 9-inch chiffon cake mold.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 45 to 50 minutes. Invert cake mold onto a cooling rack immediately after removing it from the oven. Let cake cool upside down in the mold. Loosen cooled cake from the mold using a sharp knife.']

title: Traditional Filipino Lumpia Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '15'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '30 lumpia'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground pork'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped onion'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'minced carrots'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'chopped green onions'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'thinly sliced green cabbage'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'chopped fresh cilantro (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '30', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lumpia wrappers'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'vegetable oil for frying, or as needed'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add pork; cook and stir until crumbly and no longer pink, 5 to 7 minutes. Remove pork from the pan and set aside. Drain grease from the pan, leaving just a thin coating.', 'Add onion and garlic to the pan; cook and stir until fragrant, about 2 minutes.', 'Stir in cooked pork, carrots, green onions, cabbage, and cilantro. Season with pepper, salt, garlic powder, and soy sauce. Remove from the heat, and set aside until cool enough to handle, about 5 minutes.', 'To assemble lumpia: Place 3 heaping tablespoons of filling diagonally near one corner of a lumpia wrapper, leaving a 1 Â½ inch space at both ends.', 'Fold the side along the length of the filling over the filling, tuck in both ends, and roll neatly and tightly to close.', 'Moisten the other side of the wrapper with water to seal the edge. Transfer to a plate and cover with plastic wrap to retain moisture. Repeat to assemble remaining lumpia.', 'Heat 1/2 inch vegetable oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat for 5 minutes.', 'Slide 3 to 4 lumpia into the hot oil, making sure the seams are facing down. Fry, turning occasionally, until all sides are golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain. Repeat to fry remaining lumpia.', 'Serve immediately. Enjoy!']

title: Chicken Arroz Caldo (Chicken Rice Porridge) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '5'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, diced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(2 inch) piece', 'Name': 'fresh ginger, peeled and thinly sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2 Â¼', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'chicken wings, split and tips discarded'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'fish sauce (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '5 Â¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'chicken broth'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'glutinous sweet rice'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lemon, sliced (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'fish sauce for sprinkling, if desired (Optional)'}]

title: Quick and Easy Pancit Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]

title: Chicken Tinola Recipe

title: Lumpia (Shanghai version) Recipe

directions: ['Combine ground pork, ground beef, onion, and carrot in a large bowl; mix well with hands. Gradually blend in soy sauce, salt, garlic powder, and pepper until incorporated.', 'Working one at a time, lay a wrapper on a flat surface with a corner pointing at you. Place about 2 tablespoons filling in a line, no thicker than your thumb, across the center of the wrapper. Moisten the edges of wrapper with water. Fold the bottom edge of wrapper snugly over filling. Fold in the left and right sides of wrapper towards the center. Roll up tightly to seal in filling.', 'Heat oil in a deep fryer or heavy skillet to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).', 'Working in batches, fry lumpia in hot oil, turning once, until golden brown, 3 to 4 minutes. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate. Cut lumpia in half, or serve as-is with dipping sauce.']

title: Cassava Cake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'grated, peeled yuca'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'Name': 'coconut milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'Name': 'sweetened condensed milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(12 ounce) can', 'Name': 'evaporated milk'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'eggs, beaten'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Stir yuca, coconut milk, condensed milk, evaporated milk, and eggs together in a bowl until thoroughly combined.', 'Pour into a 2-quart baking dish.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until set, about 1 hour. Turn the broiler on and bake until top of cake is browned, 2 to 3 minutes. Cool completely in the refrigerator before serving, about 1 hour.']

title: Lumpia in the Air Fryer Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '16'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '16 lumpia'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'Italian hot sausage links'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely sliced green onions'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped carrots'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped water chestnuts'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced onions'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground ginger'}, {'Quantity': '16', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'spring roll wrappers'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'avocado oil cooking spray'}]
directions: ['Remove casing from sausage and cook in a skillet over medium heat until slightly browned, 4 to 5 minutes. Add green onions, carrots, water chestnuts, and onion. Cook and stir until onions are soft and translucent, 5 to 7 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Season with soy sauce, salt, and ginger. Stir until filling is well combined; remove from heat.', 'Lay a spring roll wrapper at an angle. Place a scant 1/4 cup filling in the center of the wrapper. Fold bottom corner over filling and tuck in the sides to form a roll. Use your finger to lightly moisten edges with water. Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling. Mist each roll with avocado oil cooking spray.', 'Preheat an air fryer to 390 degrees F (198 degrees C).', 'Place lumpia rolls in the air fryer basket, making sure they are not touching; cook in batches if necessary. Fry for 4 minutes; flip and cook until skins are crispy, about 4 minutes more.']

title: Filipino Beef Steak Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'New York strip steak, sliced thin'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'lemon, juiced'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'olive oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, chopped'}]
directions: ['Place sliced beef in a large bowl. Whisk together lemon juice, soy sauce, sugar, salt, and pepper in a small bowl; pour over beef and toss to coat. Stir in cornstarch. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour to overnight.', 'Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.', 'Remove beef slices from marinade, shaking to remove any excess liquid. Discard marinade.', 'Working in batches, fry beef slices in hot oil until they start to firm and are reddish-pink and juicy in the center, 2 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer beef slices to a serving platter.', 'Heat olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir onion and garlic in hot oil until onion is golden brown, 5 to 7 minutes; spoon over beef slices.']

title: Atsara (Papaya Relish) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 day 1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 day 1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'grated fresh green papaya'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrot, peeled and sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red bell pepper, sliced into long strips'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green chile peppers, sliced into thin rings'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(2 inch) piece', 'Name': 'fresh ginger root, peeled and sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(1.5 ounce) box', 'Name': 'raisins'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white vinegar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}]
directions: ['Toss grated papaya with 1/4 cup salt together in a large bowl; allow to sit for 1 hour. Drain liquid from papaya and rinse thoroughly. Place papaya in the middle of a large piece of cheesecloth and squeeze to drain as much liquid from the papaya as possible.', 'Combine papaya, carrot, bell pepper, chile peppers, ginger, and raisins together in a clean large bowl; mix. Transfer the mixture to clean, dry jars with lids.', 'Stir vinegar, water, sugar, and 1 teaspoon salt together in a small saucepan; bring to a boil for 5 minutes. Pour the vinegar mixture into the jars, making sure the vegetables are completely submerged in liquid. Allow vegetables to marinate in the liquid at least 1 day before using. Store in the refrigerator between uses.']

title: Traci's Adobo Seasoning Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '21'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '7 tablespoons'}]

title: Empanada Dough Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '24 empanada disks'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'egg yolk'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour for dusting'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter, melted'}]
directions: ['Whisk 2 cups flour, sugar, and salt together in a bowl until well blended. Make a well in the center.', 'Whisk water and egg yolk together in a small bowl until smooth; pour into the well and mix to form a stiff dough.', 'Transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 8 minutes. Roll each slice into a disk.']

title: Adobong Pusit (Squid Adobo) Recipe

directions: ['Combine squid, vinegar, and water in a small pot over medium heat; season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes.', 'Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir onion and garlic in hot oil until softened, 5 to 7 minutes. title: Ginataang Manok (Chicken Cooked in Coconut Milk) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'canola oil'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sliced fresh ginger'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(5 pound)', 'Name': 'whole chicken, cut into pieces'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(14 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'coconut milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(10 ounce) package', 'Name': 'frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained'}]
directions: ['Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat and stir in ginger. Cook and stir until fragrant and lightly browned. Remove ginger and set aside.', 'Season chicken with salt and pepper. Place chicken in the same skillet over medium-high heat without crowding. Cook until chicken is lightly brown on all sides.', 'Return ginger to the skillet and add coconut milk. Bring to a boil, then cover with the lid tilted to allow steam to escape. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until chicken is no longer pink at the bone, about 30 minutes.', 'Stir in spinach and simmer uncovered until spinach is warmed through, 8 to 12 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.']

title: Goat Stew Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'bone-in goat meat, cut into large chunks'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vinegar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'red bell pepper, cut into 1-inch squares'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'tomato sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'beef stock'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'potato, peeled and cut into large chunks'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrots, peeled and cut into large chunks'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'green peas'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'pepper'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'cayenne pepper'}]
directions: ['Mix goat meat with vinegar, soy sauce, and garlic in a large bowl; cover and refrigerate for 1 to 8 hours. For the best flavor, marinate at least 6 hours. Remove meat from marinade and pat dry with paper towels; reserve marinade and garlic separately.', 'Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Working in batches, cook goat meat in hot oil, stirring occasionally, until browned, 10 to 15 minutes. Transfer goat meat to a plate and set aside. Reserve drippings in the pot.', 'Add onion, bell pepper, and reserved garlic to drippings. Cook and stir over medium heat until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Pour in tomato sauce; bring to a simmer. Cook until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes.', 'Return goat meat to sauce. Pour in beef stock and reserved marinade; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover the pot, and simmer until meat is partially tender, 30 to 40 minutes.', 'Stir in potato, carrots, and peas; season with salt, black pepper, and cayenne pepper. Simmer until goat meat is very tender and potato and carrots are cooked through, 20 to 30 more minutes. Adjust seasonings before serving.']

title: Filipino Lechon Kawali Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'pork belly, cut into small pieces'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bay leaves'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'oil for frying, or as needed'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Combine pork belly, garlic, bay leaves, salt, and pepper in a skillet; pour in enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until skin is tender, 35 to 45 minutes.', 'Drain and let sit at room temperature until pork has air-dried.', 'Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).', 'Fry pork in the hot oil, working in batches, until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes.', 'Remove fried pork with a slotted spoon and drain on a paper towel-lined plate.']

title: Buchi Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '10'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1 Â¼', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water, divided'}, {'Quantity': '3 Â½', 'Unit': 'ounces', 'Name': 'green mung beans'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'glutinous rice flour'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'â…›', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'quart', 'Name': 'cooking oil'}]
directions: ['Combine 1 cup water and mung beans in a pot and bring to a boil; cook over medium heat until beans are very tender, about 30 minutes. Mash beans thoroughly, then stir in 1/2 cup sugar until well combined; set aside.', 'Mix together rice flour, remaining 1/4 cup water, 2 tablespoons sugar, and salt in a large bowl; knead just enough to form a ball. Divide dough into small pieces and roll into balls. Flatten each dough ball, then spoon 1 tablespoon mashed bean mixture into the middle of dough. Wrap dough around bean mixture and pinch edges to seal.', 'Heat oil in a deep fryer or large saucepan to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Fry balls in batches in hot oil until golden brown, 5 to 10 minutes per batch. Drain on paper towels and serve hot.']

title: Filipino Beef Giniling (Afritada Style) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'oil, or as needed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'ground beef'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water, divided, or more as needed'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'red potatoes, cubed'}, {'Quantity': '10', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'baby carrots, or more to taste, cubed'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce, divided'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'raisins, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': '(6.5 ounce) cans', 'Name': 'tomato sauce with salt (such as ContadinaÂ®)'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'orange bell pepper, diced'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'white sugar'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients.', 'Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.', 'Add beef and 1/2 cup water; cook and stir until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Season with black pepper and add more water as needed; do not let beef dry out.', 'Add potatoes, carrots, and 3 tablespoons soy sauce; cook for 4 minutes, adding more water if mixture is too dry. Add raisins and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, again adding water as needed.', 'Pour in one can tomato sauce. Fill the can with water and swirl to remove excess sauce; pour into the saucepan. Stir in remaining 1/2 can sauce until combined. Add more water as needed to create a saucy but not soupy consistency.', 'Stir in bell pepper, sugar, and remaining 3 tablespoons soy sauce. Cook, stirring occasionally and adding water as needed so sauce does not dry out, until all vegetables are tender, about 3 to 5 minutes.']

title: Ube-Macapuno Cake Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 3-layer 9-inch cake'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'cake flour'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'baking powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'ube (purple yam), cooked and finely grated'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg yolks, lightly beaten'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'corn syrup'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '7', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'egg whites'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cream of tartar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'drops', 'Name': 'red food color'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'drops', 'Name': 'blue food coloring'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(12 ounce) jar', 'Name': 'macapuno (coconut preserves)'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Line the bottom of three 9-inch round pans with parchment paper, but do not grease.', 'Make the ube cake: Mix flour, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl; set aside. Place grated ube in a large bowl. Combine 3/4 cup milk and 1 teaspoon vanilla; gradually blend into ube until smooth. Blend in egg yolks, corn syrup, and oil. Beat in flour mixture until smooth; set aside.', 'Combine egg whites and cream of tartar in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until foamy. Gradually add sugar, then red and blue food coloring, continuing to beat until stiff peaks form. Fold 1/3 of the whites into batter, then quickly fold in remaining whites until no streaks remain. Pour batter into prepared pans.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 30 to 35 minutes. Invert pans on a wire rack and let cool upside down. When cool, run a knife around the edges to loosen cake from the pans. Spread coconut preserves onto the cooled cake layers; stack layers on a cake stand or serving plate.', 'Make the buttercream: Combine evaporated milk and 3/4 cup sugar; set aside. Combine butter and sugar in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Beat in food coloring, one drop at a time, until the desired tint is achieved. Frost top and sides of cake with buttercream.']

title: Filipino Lumpia Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'Name': 'lumpia wrappers'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground beef'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'ground pork'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped onion'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped green bell pepper'}, {'Quantity': 'â…“', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'finely chopped carrot'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'quart', 'Name': 'oil for frying'}]
directions: ['Thaw lumpia wrappers if frozen. Lay several wrappers on a clean, dry surface and cover with a damp towel to prevent wrappers from drying out.', 'Mix beef, pork, onion, green pepper, and carrot together in a medium bowl. Place about 2 tablespoons of meat mixture along center of wrapper. Do not overstuff wrappers or they will burn before meat is cooked. Fold one edge of wrapper over filling. Fold outer edges in slightly, then roll into a closed cylinder. Wet finger with water and moisten outer edge to seal. Repeat with remaining wrappers and filling, keeping finished lumpia covered to prevent drying.', 'Heat oil in a 9-inch skillet on medium to medium-high heat until oil reaches 365 to 375 degrees F (170 to 175 degrees C). Fry 3 to 4 lumpia at a time, turning in oil until nicely browned, about 2 to 3 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels.', 'Cut each lumpia into thirds for parties, and serve with banana ketchup, if you like.']

title: Sinigang na Bangus (Filipino Milkfish in Tamarind Broth) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '35 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '5'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '5 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onions, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'tomatoes, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'milkfish (bangus), cut into 5 pieces'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'small', 'Name': 'eggplants, sliced 1/8-inch thick'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'fresh green beans, cut into 1-inch pieces'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'white radishes (labanos), sliced'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'pods', 'Name': 'okra, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'small green chile peppers'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'watercress (kangkong) leaves and stems'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'tamarind powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}]

title: Siopao (Filipino Steamed Buns) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '16'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '16 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '3 â…“', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(.25 ounce) package', 'Name': 'active dry yeast'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'lukewarm water'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil, or as needed'}]
directions: ['Mix flour, sugar, salt, and yeast together in a large bowl. Add water and 1/4 cup oil; mix into a dough. Knead until smooth and elastic, at least 10 minutes. Place in the warmed oven until size has doubled, about 1 hour.', 'Punch down dough. Keep in the oven until risen, at least 15 minutes more. Knead dough onto a flat work surface and divide into 12 golf-sized balls. Roll out each ball and fill with choice of filling (see footnote for my chicken and pork filling). Gather and twist the edges together to secure the filling.', 'Place each siopao on a 3x3-inch piece of wax paper.', 'Place siopao in a steamer and steam for 30 minutes.']

title: Champorado Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '25 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'glutinous sweet rice'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'light coconut milk'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cocoa powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'salt'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'thick coconut milk'}]
directions: ['Combine rice and light coconut milk in a large pot; bring to a boil for 10 minutes, while stirring occasionally to keep rice from sticking to the bottom of the pot.', 'Stir cocoa powder, sugar, and salt into rice; reduce heat to low, cover, and continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until rice is tender, about 10 minutes more.', 'Pour thick coconut milk into rice mixture; stir to combine. Serve hot.']

title: Beef Nilaga Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '5'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '4 Â½', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'beef short ribs'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'quart', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onions, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'black peppercorns, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'beef bouillon cubes'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'potatoes, quartered'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'chayote squash, peeled and quartered'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrots, cut into chunks'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'stalks', 'Name': 'celery, quartered'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt to taste'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'head', 'Name': 'cabbage, cut into wedges'}]
directions: ['Place short ribs into a large pot with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil over high heat, then boil for 5 minutes; the ribs will not be fully cooked. Drain and discard cooking water.', 'Return ribs to the pot. Pour in 1 quart water, then add onions, peppercorns, and bouillon cubes. Bring to a boil, then cover, reduce the heat, and simmer for 1 hour.', 'Skim any fat floating on the surface. Stir in potatoes, chayote squash, carrots, and celery. Cover and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. Season with salt, then add cabbage and cook for 5 more minutes.']

title: Siopao (Filipino Steamed Dumplings) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 55 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '15'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '15 pieces'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'active dry yeast'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'lukewarm water'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': '4 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'rice flour, divided'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'solid vegetable shortening, divided'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'large', 'Name': 'onion, diced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'clove', 'Name': 'garlic, chopped, or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1 Â½', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'shredded cooked chicken meat'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'white sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'diced green onion'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt and black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'cornstarch, if needed (Optional)'}]
directions: ['Dissolve yeast in the water; stir in the sugar and beat in 2 1/2 cups of rice flour to make a soft sponge. Set aside in a warm place to double in bulk, about 40 minutes. Mix in 2 more cups of rice flour and 1/4 cup of shortening and place the dough on a greased work surface; knead in the remaining 1/4 cup of shortening to make a smooth dough. Cut the dough into 15 equal-sized pieces; form each piece into a ball.', 'Heat the vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat; cook and stir the onion and garlic in the hot oil until translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in the chicken, soy sauce, 2 teaspoons of sugar, green onion, salt, and pepper. If the mixture is juicy, add cornstarch to thicken.', 'Working on a lightly greased work surface, flatten a dough ball into a circle about 4 inches in diameter with the heel of your hand. Place about 1 tablespoon of filling into the center of the dough ball, bring the edges of the dough together at the top, and pinch and twist to seal in the filling. Place each filled dumpling onto waxed paper with the pinched seal at the bottom while you finish the rest of the dumplings.', 'Spray a multi-layered bamboo steamer with cooking spray, place the steamer on top of a large saucepan, and pour in water to several inches below the steamer. Bring the water to a boil.', 'Working in several batches, place 3 or 4 filled buns into each steamer layer without letting the buns touch each other or the edge of the steamer, cover the steamer, and let the buns steam over medium-low heat until puffy and the dough is springy, about 15 minutes per batch. Serve warm.']

title: Kwek Kwek (Filipino Street Food) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '12 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '12', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'quail eggs'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'ketchup'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'drop', 'Name': 'yellow food coloring'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'drop', 'Name': 'red food coloring'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'all-purpose flour'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'oil for deep frying'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'cornstarch'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'bamboo skewer'}]
directions: ['Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium, cover, and cook for 4 minutes. Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 2 minutes. Rinse eggs in cold water and cool to room temperature; peel.', 'Combine rice vinegar, ketchup, brown sugar, and soy sauce in a saucepan. Cook and stir over medium until sugar has dissolved, about 5 minutes. Let cool.', 'Prepare batter by adding red and yellow food coloring to the water to get a deep orange color. Combine flour, salt, and pepper in a bowl; pour in orange water and stir until there are no lumps.', 'Heat oil in a wok to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).', 'Gently roll eggs in cornstarch to coat and shake off excess cornstarch. Dip into orange batter so they are fully covered. Poke eggs with the bamboo skewer and drop gently into the hot oil. Deep fry until the batter is crispy, about 2 minutes per side. Remove eggs with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.']

title: Chewy Coconut Bibingka (Filipino Rice Cake) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '24'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '24 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(13.5 ounce) can', 'Name': 'coconut milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(14 ounce) can', 'Name': 'sweetened condensed milk'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'stick', 'Name': 'butter, melted'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'eggs'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '(12 ounce) jars', 'Name': 'macapuno strings in heavy syrup'}, {'Quantity': '2 Â½', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'sweet rice flour (mochiko)'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'packed brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vanilla extract'}]
directions: ['Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 12x17-inch rimmed baking sheet.', 'Beat condensed milk, coconut milk, and melted butter together in a large mixing bowl until combined. Add eggs, 1 at a time, and beat until combined. Add macapuno, 1 jar at a time, and beat until combined. Gradually beat in mochiko flour. Beat in brown sugar; beat in vanilla extract. Pour batter onto the prepared baking sheet.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden brown and sides are slightly dark brown, 45 to 50 minutes.', 'Allow to cool, about 20 minutes, before loosening the sides and cutting into squares.']

title: Filipino Steamed Rice, Cebu Style Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '4 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'pork belly, cut into 3/4-inch cubes'}]
directions: ['Mix pork belly with cooking wine, oyster sauce, cornstarch, sesame oil, salt, and black pepper in a bowl. Marinate in the refrigerator, at least 20 minutes.', 'Heat vegetable oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Add garlic and shallots; cook and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the pork pieces; fry until browned, about 6 minutes. Pour in water, light soy sauce, and dark soy sauce. Cover with a lid and bring stew to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook until pork becomes tender and water is reduced by half, about 30 minutes.', 'Cut shrimp into 3/4-inch pieces. Mix cornstarch and water together in a bowl.', 'Bring stew to a boil. Add the shrimp and peas; cook until shrimp changes color, about 2 minutes. Quickly stir in the cornstarch mixture. Cook and stir until gravy is thickened, 7 to 10 minutes.', 'Heat oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Saute garlic until fragrant, about 1 minute. Increase heat to high. Add rice; cook, breaking up the rice with a spatula, until loosened, 3 to 5 minutes. Add oyster sauce and soy sauce. Cook and stir until rice is fluffy and heated through, about 3 minutes. Add remaining sesame oil.', 'Divide fried rice between 3 or 4 bowls. Portion the pork and shrimp stew equally over the rice.']

title: Filipino Ribs Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 45 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '2 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'pork spareribs'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'onions, cut into wedges'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'soy sauce, divided'}, {'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'whole star anise pods'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¼', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'medium', 'Name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'honey'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'brown sugar'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'grated fresh ginger'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'lemon juice'}]
directions: ['Place ribs, 2 onions cut into wedges, 4 tablespoons soy sauce, star anise pods, and black pepper in a large stock pot . Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low, cover, and simmer until ribs are tender when pierced, about 1 Â¼ hours, stirring occasionally.', 'Meanwhile, heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add 1 onion chopped; cook and stir until onion is soft. Stir in honey, brown sugar, remaining 2 tablespoons soy sauce, ginger, Worcestershire sauce, and lemon juice; cook and stir until well blended. Remove from heat.', 'Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).', 'Remove ribs from stock pot using tongs; arrange in a single layer in an 11x16-inch baking pan. Brush evenly with honey glaze.', 'Bake in the preheated oven, basting often with pan drippings, until ribs are well glazed, about 30 minutes.']

title: Filipino Chicken Sopas Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '6 servings'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '6', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water, or more as needed'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pound', 'Name': 'bone-in chicken thighs, skin removed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'garlic powder'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'onion powder'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrots, diced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'fish sauce, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '4', 'Unit': 'teaspoons', 'Name': 'chicken bouillon granules'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'Name': 'elbow macaroni'}, {'Quantity': 'Â½', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'evaporated milk'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'butter'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'pinch', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}]
directions: ['Combine water and onion in a pot and bring to a boil. Add chicken, garlic powder, and onion powder. Bring back to a boil and reduce heat to medium-low. Simmer broth until chicken thighs are tender, about 30 minutes.', 'Remove chicken and add carrots to the broth. Stir in 2 tablespoons fish sauce, chicken bouillon, and black pepper.', 'Shred chicken meat and discard bones; return meat to the broth and simmer until carrots are tender, about 10 minutes. Add macaroni; cook until tender, about 20 minutes, adding more water if needed. Stir in evaporated milk and butter; simmer until butter is melted. Add more fish sauce and season with salt and pepper to taste. Pour soup into serving bowls.']

title: Leche Flan Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 10 mins'}, {'Label': 'Additional Time:', 'Value': '5 hrs'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '6 hrs 20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '12'}, {'Label': 'Yield:', 'Value': '1 (10-inch) flan'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'sugar'}, {'Quantity': 'Â¾', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'water'}]
directions: ['Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).', 'Combine sugar and water in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil without stirring to avoid the mixture crystallizing. Continue to boil, swirling the pan occasionally, until sugar syrup begins to brown, 7 to 10 minutes. Reduce the heat to medium low and watch the color.', 'Once the caramel is a deep brown, 2 to 3 minutes, immediately pour it into a 10-inch flan mold. Carefully tilt the mold to make sure the whole bottom surface is covered.', 'Combine evaporated milk, condensed milk, egg yolks, and vanilla extract in a large bowl. Stir lightly to prevent bubbles or foam from forming; strain batter.', 'Place a roasting pan large enough to hold the flan mold on the oven rack. Fold two 32-inch long sheets of foil lengthwise in quarters to make strips. Cross the strips and place the flan mold in the roasting pan, with the ends of the strips extending over the edges of the roasting pan. Crimp ends slightly to keep them in place.', 'Slowly pour the custard mixture into the caramel-lined flan mold.', 'Add enough hot water to the roasting pan to come halfway up the side of the mold. Cover the roasting pan with aluminum foil.', 'Bake in the preheated oven until firm and a knife inserted near the center comes out clean, about 1 hour. Carefully remove the roasting pan from the oven. Carefully remove the flan mold from the roasting pan using the foil strips. Let cool on a wire rack, about 1 hour. Cover and chill in the refrigerator until completely cool, at least 4 hours or overnight.', 'Run a paring knife around the edges of the flan. Cover the mold with a rimmed platter and carefully flip it over to release the flan from the mold for serving. Scrape any excess caramel from the mold over the flan.']

title: Sinigang na Isda sa Miso (Fish Stew with Miso) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(1 inch) piece', 'Name': 'fresh ginger, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'tomatoes, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'miso paste, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'teaspoon', 'Name': 'patis (fish sauce), or to taste'}, {'Quantity': '5', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'pounds', 'Name': 'red snapper fillets'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'white (daikon) radish, sliced'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'bunch', 'Name': 'Chinese mustard greens with stalks'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green chile peppers, or more to taste'}, {'Quantity': '2', 'Unit': 'tablespoons', 'Name': 'kalamansi (Filipino lemon) juice, or more to taste'}]
directions: ['Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Cook and stir onion, garlic, and ginger in hot oil until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes; cook and stir until mushy, about 5 minutes. Stir in miso paste and fish sauce; simmer until flavors combine, about 2 minutes.', 'Pour water into the pot; bring to a boil. Add snapper fillets and radish; simmer until radish softens slightly, about 2 minutes. Stir in mustard greens, chile peppers, and kalamansi juice. Simmer, uncovered, until greens are wilted, 1 to 2 minutes.']

title: Chicken Afritada (Filipino Stew) Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '40 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '50 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '1 hr 30 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '6'}]
ingredients: [{'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'tablespoon', 'Name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cloves', 'Name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'seeded and chopped tomatoes'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '(3 pound)', 'Name': 'whole chicken, cut into pieces'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': 'cups', 'Name': 'water'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': 'cup', 'Name': 'tomato sauce (Optional)'}, {'Quantity': '3', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'potatoes, quartered'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'green bell pepper, seeded and cut into matchsticks'}, {'Quantity': '1', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'carrot, chopped'}, {'Quantity': '', 'Unit': '', 'Name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}]
directions: ['Heat oil in a large wok over medium heat. Add garlic; cook and stir until fragrant, about 3 minutes. Add onion; cook and stir until translucent, about 5 minutes. Stir in chopped tomatoes; cook, mashing with a fork, until flesh and skin separate, about 5 minutes.', 'Add chicken to the wok; cook and stir until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Pour in water; cover and bring to a boil. Stir in tomato sauce; simmer until flavors combine, about 15 minutes.', 'Add potatoes to the wok; simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in bell pepper and carrot; simmer until softened, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and black pepper.']

title: Garlic Rice Recipe
time: [{'Label': 'Prep Time:', 'Value': '5 mins'}, {'Label': 'Cook Time:', 'Value': '15 mins'}, {'Label': 'Total Time:', 'Value': '20 mins'}, {'Label': 'Servings:', 'Value': '4'}]
